48.text: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय |बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणा: फलहेतव: || 49||

word_meanings.buddhi-yogāt: with the intellect established in divine knowledge
word_meanings.phala-hetavaḥ: those seeking fruits of their work

48.transliteration: dūreṇa hy-avaraṁ karma buddhi-yogād dhanañjayabuddhau śharaṇam anvichchha kṛipaṇāḥ phala-hetavaḥ

49.meaning: One who prudently practices the science of work without attachment can get rid of both good and bad reactions in this life itself. Therefore, strive for Yog, which is the art of working skillfully (in proper consciousness).
49.text: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते |तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योग: कर्मसु कौशलम् || 50||
49.transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛita-duṣhkṛitetasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśhalam

50.meaning: The wise endowed with equanimity of intellect, abandon attachment to the fruits of actions, which bind one to the cycle of life and death. By working in such consciousness, they attain the state beyond all suffering.
50.text: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिण: |जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ता: पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् || 51||

word_meanings.janma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ: freedom from the bondage of life and death

50.transliteration: karma-jaṁ buddhi-yuktā hi phalaṁ tyaktvā manīṣhiṇaḥjanma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ padaṁ gachchhanty-anāmayam

51.meaning: When your intellect crosses the quagmire of delusion, you will then acquire indifference to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard (about enjoyments in this world and the next).
51.text: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति |तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च || 52||

word_meanings.śhrotavyasya: to what is yet to be heard

51.transliteration: yadā te moha-kalilaṁ buddhir vyatitariṣhyatitadā gantāsi nirvedaṁ śhrotavyasya śhrutasya cha

52.meaning: When your intellect ceases to be allured by the fruitive sections of the Vedas and remains steadfast in divine consciousness, you will then attain the state of perfect Yog.
52.text: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला |समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि || 53||

word_meanings.śhruti-vipratipannā: not allured by the fruitive sections of the Vedas

52.transliteration: śhruti-vipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niśhchalāsamādhāv-achalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi

53.meaning: Arjun said : O Keshav, what is the disposition of one who is situated in divine consciousness? How does an enlightened person talk? How does he sit? How does he walk?
53.text: अर्जुन उवाच |स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव |स्थितधी: किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् || 54||

word_meanings.keśhava: Shree Krishna, killer of the Keshi Demon

53.transliteration: arjuna uvāchasthita-prajñasya kā bhāṣhā samādhi-sthasya keśhavasthita-dhīḥ kiṁ prabhāṣheta kim āsīta vrajeta kim

54.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: O Parth, when one discards all selfish desires and cravings of the senses that torment the mind, and becomes satisfied in the realization of the self, such a person is said to be transcendentally situated.
54.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् |आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्ट: स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते || 55||
54.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaprajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha mano-gatānātmany-evātmanā tuṣhṭaḥ sthita-prajñas tadochyate

55.meaning: One whose mind remains undisturbed amidst misery, who does not crave for pleasure, and who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.
55.transliteration: duḥkheṣhv-anudvigna-manāḥ sukheṣhu vigata-spṛihaḥvīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhaḥ sthita-dhīr munir uchyate

56.meaning: One who remains unattached under all conditions, and is neither delighted by good fortune nor dejected by tribulation, he is a sage with perfect knowledge.
56.text: य: सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् |नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता || 57||
56.transliteration: yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śhubhāśhubhamnābhinandati na dveṣhṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā

57.meaning: One who is able to withdraw the senses from their objects, just as a tortoise withdraws its limbs into its shell, is established in divine wisdom.
57.text: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वश: |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता || 58||
57.transliteration: yadā sanharate chāyaṁ kūrmo ’ṅgānīva sarvaśhaḥindriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā

58.meaning: Aspirants may restrain the senses from their objects of enjoyment, but the taste for the sense objects remains. However, even this taste ceases for those who realizes the Supreme.
58.text: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिन: |रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते || 59||
58.transliteration: viṣhayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥrasa-varjaṁ raso ’pyasya paraṁ dṛiṣhṭvā nivartate

59.meaning: The senses are so strong and turbulent, O son of Kunti, that they can forcibly carry away the mind even of a person endowed with discrimination who practices self-control.
59.text: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चित: |इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मन: || 60||
59.transliteration: yatato hyapi kaunteya puruṣhasya vipaśhchitaḥindriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṁ manaḥ

60.meaning: They are established in perfect knowledge, who subdue their senses and keep their minds ever absorbed in Me.
60.text: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्पर: |वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता || 61||
60.transliteration: tāni sarvāṇi sanyamya yukta āsīta mat-paraḥvaśhe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā

61.meaning: While contemplating on the objects of the senses, one develops attachment to them. Attachment leads to desire, and from desire arises anger.
61.transliteration: dhyāyato viṣhayān puṁsaḥ saṅgas teṣhūpajāyatesaṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho ’bhijāyate

62.meaning: Anger leads to clouding of judgment, which results in bewilderment of memory. When memory is bewildered, the intellect gets destroyed; and when the intellect is destroyed, one is ruined.
62.transliteration: krodhād bhavati sammohaḥ sammohāt smṛiti-vibhramaḥsmṛiti-bhranśhād buddhi-nāśho buddhi-nāśhāt praṇaśhyati

63.meaning: But one who controls the mind, and is free from attachment and aversion, even while using the objects of the senses, attains the Grace of God.
63.transliteration: rāga-dveṣha-viyuktais tu viṣhayān indriyaiśh charanātma-vaśhyair-vidheyātmā prasādam adhigachchhati

64.meaning: By divine grace comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and the intellect of such a person of tranquil mind soon becomes firmly established in God.
64.text: प्रसादे सर्वदु:खानां हानिरस्योपजायते |प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धि: पर्यवतिष्ठते || 65||
64.transliteration: prasāde sarva-duḥkhānāṁ hānir asyopajāyateprasanna-chetaso hyāśhu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣhṭhate

65.meaning: But an undisciplined person, who has not controlled the mind and senses, can neither have a resolute intellect nor steady contemplation on God. For one who never unites the mind with God there is no peace; and how can one who lacks peace be happy?
65.text: नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना |न चाभावयत: शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुत: सुखम् || 66||
65.transliteration: nāsti buddhir-ayuktasya na chāyuktasya bhāvanāna chābhāvayataḥ śhāntir aśhāntasya kutaḥ sukham

66.meaning: Just as a strong wind sweeps a boat off its chartered course on the water, even one of the senses on which the mind focuses can lead the intellect astray.
66.text: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते |तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि || 67||
66.transliteration: indriyāṇāṁ hi charatāṁ yan mano ’nuvidhīyatetadasya harati prajñāṁ vāyur nāvam ivāmbhasi

67.meaning: Therefore, one who has restrained the senses from their objects, O mighty armed Arjun, is firmly established in transcendental knowledge.
67.text: तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वश: |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता || 68||
67.transliteration: tasmād yasya mahā-bāho nigṛihītāni sarvaśhaḥindriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā

68.meaning: What all beings consider as day is the night of ignorance for the wise, and what all creatures see as night is the day for the introspective sage.
68.text: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी |यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुने: || 69||
68.transliteration: yā niśhā sarva-bhūtānāṁ tasyāṁ jāgarti sanyamīyasyāṁ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśhā paśhyato muneḥ

69.meaning: Just as the ocean remains undisturbed by the incessant flow of waters from rivers merging into it, likewise the sage who is unmoved despite the flow of desirable objects all around him attains peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy desires.
69.text: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठंसमुद्रमाप: प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् |तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वेस शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी || 70||

word_meanings.kāma-kāmī: one who strives to satisfy desires

69.transliteration: āpūryamāṇam achala-pratiṣhṭhaṁsamudram āpaḥ praviśhanti yadvattadvat kāmā yaṁ praviśhanti sarvesa śhāntim āpnoti na kāma-kāmī

70.meaning: That person, who gives up all material desires and lives free from a sense of greed, proprietorship, and egoism, attains perfect peace.
70.text: विहाय कामान्य: सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति नि:स्पृह: |निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: स शान्तिमधिगच्छति || 71||
70.transliteration: vihāya kāmān yaḥ sarvān pumānśh charati niḥspṛihaḥnirmamo nirahankāraḥ sa śhāntim adhigachchhati

71.meaning: O Parth, such is the state of an enlightened soul that having attained it, one is never again deluded. Being established in this consciousness even at the hour of death, one is liberated from the cycle of life and death and reaches the Supreme Abode of God.
71.text: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थिति: पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति |स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति || 72||
71.transliteration: eṣhā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṁ prāpya vimuhyatisthitvāsyām anta-kāle ’pi brahma-nirvāṇam ṛichchhati

1.meaning: Arjun said: O Janardan, if You consider knowledge superior to action, then why do You ask me to wage this terrible war? My intellect is bewildered by Your ambiguous advice. Please tell me decisively the one path by which I may attain the highest good.
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन |तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव || 1||व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे |तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम् || 2||

word_meanings.janārdana: he who looks after the public, Krishna
word_meanings.keśhava: Krishna, the killer of the demon named Keshi

1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchajyāyasī chet karmaṇas te matā buddhir janārdanatat kiṁ karmaṇi ghore māṁ niyojayasi keśhavavyāmiśhreṇeva vākyena buddhiṁ mohayasīva metad ekaṁ vada niśhchitya yena śhreyo ’ham āpnuyām

2.meaning: The Lord said: O sinless one, the two paths leading to enlightenment were previously explained by Me: the path of knowledge, for those inclined toward contemplation, and the path of work for those inclined toward action.
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ |ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् || 3||
2.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaloke ’smin dvi-vidhā niṣhṭhā purā proktā mayānaghajñāna-yogena sāṅkhyānāṁ karma-yogena yoginām

3.meaning: One cannot achieve freedom from karmic reactions by merely abstaining from work, nor can one attain perfection of knowledge by mere physical renunciation.
3.text: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते |न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति || 4||
3.transliteration: na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣhkarmyaṁ puruṣho ’śhnutena cha sannyasanād eva siddhiṁ samadhigachchhati

4.meaning: There is no one who can remain without action even for a moment. Indeed, all beings are compelled to act by their qualities born of material nature (the three
4.text: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् |कार्यते ह्यवश: कर्म सर्व: प्रकृतिजैर्गुणै: || 5||
4.transliteration: na hi kaśhchit kṣhaṇam api jātu tiṣhṭhatyakarma-kṛitkāryate hyavaśhaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛiti-jair guṇaiḥ

5.meaning: Those who restrain the external organs of action, while continuing to dwell on sense objects in the mind, certainly delude themselves and are to be called hypocrites.
5.text: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् |इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचार: स उच्यते || 6||
5.transliteration: karmendriyāṇi sanyamya ya āste manasā smaranindriyārthān vimūḍhātmā mithyāchāraḥ sa uchyate

6.meaning: But those karm yogis who control their knowledge senses with the mind, O Arjun, and engage the working senses in working without attachment, are certainly superior.
6.text: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन |कर्मेन्द्रियै: कर्मयोगमसक्त: स विशिष्यते || 7||
6.transliteration: yas tvindriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate ’rjunakarmendriyaiḥ karma-yogam asaktaḥ sa viśhiṣhyate

7.meaning: You should thus perform your prescribed Vedic duties, since action is superior to inaction. By ceasing activity, even your bodily maintenance will not be possible.
7.text: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मण: |शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मण: || 8||
7.transliteration: niyataṁ kuru karma tvaṁ karma jyāyo hyakarmaṇaḥśharīra-yātrāpi cha te na prasiddhyed akarmaṇaḥ

8.meaning: Work must be done as a yajna to the Supreme Lord; otherwise, work causes bondage in this material world. Therefore, O son of Kunti, for the satisfaction of God, perform your prescribed duties, without being attached to the results.
8.text: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धन: |तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्ग: समाचर || 9||
8.transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo ’nyatra loko ’yaṁ karma-bandhanaḥtad-arthaṁ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samāchara

9.meaning: In the beginning of creation, Brahma created humankind along with duties, and said, “Prosper in the performance of these
9.text: सहयज्ञा: प्रजा: सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापति: |अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् || 10||
9.transliteration: saha-yajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛiṣhṭvā purovācha prajāpatiḥanena prasaviṣhyadhvam eṣha vo ’stviṣhṭa-kāma-dhuk

10.meaning: By your sacrifices, the celestial gods will be pleased, and by cooperation between humans and the celestial gods, great prosperity will reign for all.
10.text: देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु व: |परस्परं भावयन्त: श्रेय: परमवाप्स्यथ || 11||
10.transliteration: devān bhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥparasparaṁ bhāvayantaḥ śhreyaḥ param avāpsyatha

11.meaning: The celestial gods, being satisfied by the performance of sacrifice, will grant you all the desired necessities of life. But those who enjoy what is given to them, without making offerings in return, are verily thieves.
11.text: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविता: |तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव स: || 12||
11.transliteration: iṣhṭān bhogān hi vo devā dāsyante yajña-bhāvitāḥtair dattān apradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ

12.meaning: The spiritually-minded, who eat food that is first offered in sacrifice, are released from all kinds of sin. Others, who cook food for their own enjoyment, verily eat only sin.
12.text: यज्ञशिष्टाशिन: सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषै: |भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् || 13||

word_meanings.yajña-śhiṣhṭa: remnants of food offered in sacrifice

12.transliteration: yajña-śhiṣhṭāśhinaḥ santo muchyante sarva-kilbiṣhaiḥbhuñjate te tvaghaṁ pāpā ye pachantyātma-kāraṇāt

13.meaning: All living beings subsist on food, and food is produced by rains. Rains come from the performance of sacrifice, and sacrifice is produced by the performance of prescribed duties.
13.text: अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भव: |यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञ: कर्मसमुद्भव: || 14||
13.transliteration: annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād anna-sambhavaḥyajñād bhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karma-samudbhavaḥ

14.meaning: The duties for human beings are described in the Vedas, and the Vedas are manifested by God Himself. Therefore, the all-pervading Lord is eternally present in acts of sacrifice.
14.text: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् |तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् || 15||
14.transliteration: karma brahmodbhavaṁ viddhi brahmākṣhara-samudbhavamtasmāt sarva-gataṁ brahma nityaṁ yajñe pratiṣhṭhitam

15.meaning: O Parth, those who do not accept their responsibility in the cycle of sacrifice established by the Vedas are sinful. They live only for the delight of their senses; indeed their lives are in vain.
15.text: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह य: |अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति || 16||

word_meanings.indriya-ārāmaḥ: for the delight of their senses

15.transliteration: evaṁ pravartitaṁ chakraṁ nānuvartayatīha yaḥaghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṁ pārtha sa jīvati

16.meaning: But those who rejoice in the self, who are illumined and fully satisfied in the self, for them, there is no duty.
16.text: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानव: |आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते || 17||
16.transliteration: yas tvātma-ratir eva syād ātma-tṛiptaśh cha mānavaḥātmanyeva cha santuṣhṭas tasya kāryaṁ na vidyate

17.meaning: Such self-realized souls have nothing to gain or lose either in discharging or renouncing their duties. Nor do they need to depend on other living beings to fulfill their self-interest.
17.text: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन |न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रय: || 18||
17.transliteration: naiva tasya kṛitenārtho nākṛiteneha kaśhchanana chāsya sarva-bhūteṣhu kaśhchid artha-vyapāśhrayaḥ

18.meaning: Therefore, giving up attachment, perform actions as a matter of duty because by working without being attached to the fruits, one attains the Supreme.
18.text: तस्मादसक्त: सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर |असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुष: || 19||
18.transliteration: tasmād asaktaḥ satataṁ kāryaṁ karma samācharaasakto hyācharan karma param āpnoti pūruṣhaḥ

19.meaning: By performing their prescribed duties, King Janak and others attained perfection. You should also perform your duties to set an example for the good of the world. Whatever actions great persons perform, common people follow. Whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.
19.text: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादय: |लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि || 20||यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जन: |स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते || 21||

word_meanings.karmaṇā: by the performance of prescribed duties
word_meanings.loka-saṅgraham: for the welfare of the masses

19.transliteration: karmaṇaiva hi sansiddhim āsthitā janakādayaḥloka-saṅgraham evāpi sampaśhyan kartum arhasiyad yad ācharati śhreṣhṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥsa yat pramāṇaṁ kurute lokas tad anuvartate

20.meaning: There is no duty for Me to do in all the three worlds, O Parth, nor do I have anything to gain or attain. Yet, I am engaged in prescribed duties.
20.text: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन |नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि || 22||
20.transliteration: na me pārthāsti kartavyaṁ triṣhu lokeṣhu kiñchananānavāptam avāptavyaṁ varta eva cha karmaṇi

21.meaning: For if I did not carefully perform the prescribed duties, O Parth, all men would follow My path in all respects.
21.text: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रित: |मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्या: पार्थ सर्वश: || 23||

word_meanings.karmaṇi: in the performance of prescribed duties

21.transliteration: yadi hyahaṁ na varteyaṁ jātu karmaṇyatandritaḥmama vartmānuvartante manuṣhyāḥ pārtha sarvaśhaḥ

22.meaning: If I ceased to perform prescribed actions, all these worlds would perish. I would be responsible for the pandemonium that would prevail, and would thereby destroy the peace of the human race.
22.text: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् |सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमा: प्रजा: || 24||
22.transliteration: utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṁ karma ched ahamsankarasya cha kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ

23.meaning: As ignorant people perform their duties with attachment to the results, O scion of Bharat, so should the wise act without attachment, for the sake of leading people on the right path.
23.transliteration: saktāḥ karmaṇyavidvānso yathā kurvanti bhāratakuryād vidvāns tathāsaktaśh chikīrṣhur loka-saṅgraham

24.meaning: The wise should not create discord in the intellects of ignorant people, who are attached to fruitive actions, by inducing them to stop work. Rather, by performing their duties in an enlightened manner, they should inspire the ignorant also to do their prescribed duties.
24.text: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् |जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्त: समाचरन् || 26||

word_meanings.karma-saṅginām: who are attached to fruitive actions

24.transliteration: na buddhi-bhedaṁ janayed ajñānāṁ karma-saṅgināmjoṣhayet sarva-karmāṇi vidvān yuktaḥ samācharan

25.meaning: All activities are carried out by the three modes of material nature. But in ignorance, the soul, deluded by false identification with the body, thinks of itself as the doer.
25.text: प्रकृते: क्रियमाणानि गुणै: कर्माणि सर्वश: |अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते || 27||

word_meanings.ahankāra-vimūḍha-ātmā: those who are bewildered by the ego and misidentify themselves with the body

25.transliteration: prakṛiteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśhaḥahankāra-vimūḍhātmā kartāham iti manyate

26.meaning: O mighty-armed Arjun, illumined persons distinguish the soul as distinct from
26.text: तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयो: |गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते || 28||

word_meanings.guṇāḥ: modes of material nature in the shape of the senses, mind, and others
word_meanings.guṇeṣhu: modes of material nature in the shape of objects of perception

26.transliteration: tattva-vit tu mahā-bāho guṇa-karma-vibhāgayoḥguṇā guṇeṣhu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate

27.meaning: Those who are deluded by the operation of the

word_meanings.guṇa: by the modes of material nature

27.transliteration: prakṛiter guṇa-sammūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇa-karmasutān akṛitsna-vido mandān kṛitsna-vin na vichālayet

28.meaning: Performing all works as an offering unto Me, constantly meditate on Me as the Supreme. Become free from desire and selfishness, and with your mental grief departed, fight!
28.text: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा |निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वर: || 30||

word_meanings.adhyātma-chetasā: with the thoughts resting on God
word_meanings.nirāśhīḥ: free from hankering for the results of the actions

28.transliteration: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi sannyasyādhyātma-chetasānirāśhīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigata-jvaraḥ

29.meaning: Those who abide by these teachings of Mine, with profound faith and free from envy, are released from the bondage of karma.
29.text: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवा: |श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभि: || 31||
29.transliteration: ye me matam idaṁ nityam anutiṣhṭhanti mānavāḥśhraddhāvanto ’nasūyanto muchyante te ’pi karmabhiḥ

30.meaning: But those who find faults with My teachings, being bereft of knowledge and devoid of discrimination, they disregard these principles and bring about their own ruin.
30.text: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् |सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतस: || 32||
30.transliteration: ye tvetad abhyasūyanto nānutiṣhṭhanti me matamsarva-jñāna-vimūḍhāns tān viddhi naṣhṭān achetasaḥ

31.meaning: Even wise people act according to their natures, for all living beings are propelled by their natural tendencies. What will one gain by repression?
31.text: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्या: प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि |प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रह: किं करिष्यति || 33||
31.transliteration: sadṛiśhaṁ cheṣhṭate svasyāḥ prakṛiter jñānavān apiprakṛitiṁ yānti bhūtāni nigrahaḥ kiṁ kariṣhyati

32.meaning: The senses naturally experience attachment and aversion to the sense objects, but do not be controlled by them, for they are way-layers and foes.
32.text: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ |तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ || 34||
32.transliteration: indriyasyendriyasyārthe rāga-dveṣhau vyavasthitautayor na vaśham āgachchhet tau hyasya paripanthinau

33.meaning: It is far better to perform one’s natural prescribed duty, though tinged with faults, than to perform another’s prescribed duty, though perfectly. In fact, it is preferable to die in the discharge of one’s duty, than to follow the path of another, which is fraught with danger.
33.text: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुण: परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् |स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेय: परधर्मो भयावह: || 35||
33.transliteration: śhreyān swa-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitātswa-dharme nidhanaṁ śhreyaḥ para-dharmo bhayāvahaḥ

34.meaning: Arjun asked: Why is a person impelled to commit sinful acts, even unwillingly, as if by force, O descendent of Vrishni (Krishna)?
34.text: अर्जुन उवाच |अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुष: |अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजित: || 36||

word_meanings.vārṣhṇeya: he who belongs to the Vrishni clan, Shree Krishna

34.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaatha kena prayukto ’yaṁ pāpaṁ charati pūruṣhaḥanichchhann api vārṣhṇeya balād iva niyojitaḥ

35.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: It is lust alone, which is born of contact with the mode of passion, and later transformed into anger. Know this as the sinful, all-devouring enemy in the world.
35.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भव: ||महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् || 37||
35.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchakāma eṣha krodha eṣha rajo-guṇa-samudbhavaḥmahāśhano mahā-pāpmā viddhyenam iha vairiṇam

36.meaning: Just as a fire is covered by smoke, a mirror is masked by dust, and an embryo is concealed by the womb, similarly one’s knowledge gets shrouded by desire.
36.text: धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च |यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम् || 38||
36.transliteration: dhūmenāvriyate vahnir yathādarśho malena chayatholbenāvṛito garbhas tathā tenedam āvṛitam

37.meaning: The knowledge of even the most discerning gets covered by this perpetual enemy in the form of insatiable desire, which is never satisfied and burns like fire, O son of Kunti.
37.text: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा |कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च || 39||
37.transliteration: āvṛitaṁ jñānam etena jñānino nitya-vairiṇākāma-rūpeṇa kaunteya duṣhpūreṇānalena cha

38.meaning: The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be breeding grounds of desire. Through them, it clouds one’s knowledge and deludes the embodied soul.
38.transliteration: indriyāṇi mano buddhir asyādhiṣhṭhānam uchyateetair vimohayatyeṣha jñānam āvṛitya dehinam

39.meaning: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, in the very beginning bring the senses under control and slay this enemy called desire, which is the embodiment of sin and destroys knowledge and realization.
39.text: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ |पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् || 41||

word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: Arjun, the best of the Bharatas

39.transliteration: tasmāt tvam indriyāṇyādau niyamya bharatarṣhabhapāpmānaṁ prajahi hyenaṁ jñāna-vijñāna-nāśhanam

40.meaning: The senses are superior to the gross body, and superior to the senses is the mind. Beyond the mind is the intellect, and even beyond the intellect is the soul.
40.text: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्य: परं मन: |मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धे: परतस्तु स: || 42||
40.transliteration: indriyāṇi parāṇyāhur indriyebhyaḥ paraṁ manaḥmanasas tu parā buddhir yo buddheḥ paratas tu saḥ

41.meaning: Thus knowing the soul to be superior to the material intellect, O mighty armed Arjun, subdue the lower self (senses, mind, and intellect) by the higher self (strength of the soul), and kill this formidable enemy called lust.
41.text: एवं बुद्धे: परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना |जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् || 43||

word_meanings.ātmānam: the lower self (senses, mind, and intellect)

41.transliteration: evaṁ buddheḥ paraṁ buddhvā sanstabhyātmānam ātmanājahi śhatruṁ mahā-bāho kāma-rūpaṁ durāsadam

1.meaning: The Supreme Lord Shree Krishna said: I taught this eternal science of Yog to the Sun God, Vivasvan, who passed it on to Manu; and Manu, in turn, instructed it to Ikshvaku.
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् |विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् || 1||

word_meanings.śhrī-bhagavān uvācha: the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna said
word_meanings.manave: to Manu, the original progenitor of humankind
word_meanings.ikṣhvākave: to Ikshvaku, first king of the Solar dynasty

1.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaimaṁ vivasvate yogaṁ proktavān aham avyayamvivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣhvākave ’bravīt

2.meaning: O subduer of enemies, the saintly kings thus received this science of Yog in a continuous tradition. But with the long passage of time, it was lost to the world.
2.text: एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदु: |स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्ट: परन्तप || 2||

word_meanings.kālena: with the long passage of time

2.transliteration: evaṁ paramparā-prāptam imaṁ rājarṣhayo viduḥsa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣhṭaḥ parantapa

3.meaning: The same ancient knowledge of Yog, which is the supreme secret, I am today revealing unto you, because you are My friend as well as My devotee, who can understand this transcendental wisdom.
3.text: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योग: प्रोक्त: पुरातन: |भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् || 3||
3.transliteration: sa evāyaṁ mayā te ’dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥbhakto ’si me sakhā cheti rahasyaṁ hyetad uttamam

4.meaning: Arjun said: You were born much after Vivasvan. How am I to understand that in the beginning You instructed this science to him?
4.text: अर्जुन उवाच |अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वत: |कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति || 4||
4.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaaparaṁ bhavato janma paraṁ janma vivasvataḥkatham etad vijānīyāṁ tvam ādau proktavān iti

5.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Both you and I have had many births, O Arjun. You have forgotten them, while I remember them all, O Parantapa.
5.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन |तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप || 5||
5.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchabahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava chārjunatānyahaṁ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṁ vettha parantapa

6.meaning: Although I am unborn, the Lord of all living entities, and have an imperishable nature, yet I appear in this world by virtue of
6.text: अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् |प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया || 6||
6.transliteration: ajo ’pi sannavyayātmā bhūtānām īśhvaro ’pi sanprakṛitiṁ svām adhiṣhṭhāya sambhavāmyātma-māyayā

7.meaning: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjun, at that time I manifest Myself on earth.
7.text: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत |अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् || 7||
7.transliteration: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārataabhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṁ sṛijāmyaham

8.meaning: To protect the righteous, to annihilate the wicked, and to reestablish the principles of dharma I appear on this earth, age after age.
8.text: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् |धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे || 8||
8.transliteration: paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṁ vināśhāya cha duṣhkṛitāmdharma-sansthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge

9.meaning: Those who understand the divine nature of My birth and activities, O Arjun, upon leaving the body, do not have to take birth again, but come to My eternal abode.
9.text: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: |त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन || 9||
9.transliteration: janma karma cha me divyam evaṁ yo vetti tattvataḥtyaktvā dehaṁ punar janma naiti mām eti so ’rjuna

10.meaning: Being free from attachment, fear, and anger, becoming fully absorbed in Me, and taking refuge in Me, many persons in the past became purified by knowledge of Me, and thus attained My divine love.
10.text: वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिता: |बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागता: || 10||
10.transliteration: vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhā man-mayā mām upāśhritāḥbahavo jñāna-tapasā pūtā mad-bhāvam āgatāḥ

11.meaning: In whatever way people surrender unto Me, I reciprocate accordingly. Everyone follows My path, knowingly or unknowingly, O son of Pritha.
11.text: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् |मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्या: पार्थ सर्वश: || 11||
11.transliteration: ye yathā māṁ prapadyante tāns tathaiva bhajāmyahammama vartmānuvartante manuṣhyāḥ pārtha sarvaśhaḥ

12.meaning: In this world, those desiring success in material activities worship the celestial gods, since material rewards manifest quickly.
12.text: काङ् क्षन्त: कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवता: |क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा || 12||
12.transliteration: kāṅkṣhantaḥ karmaṇāṁ siddhiṁ yajanta iha devatāḥkṣhipraṁ hi mānuṣhe loke siddhir bhavati karmajā

13.meaning: The four categories of occupations were created by Me according to people’s qualities and activities. Although I am the Creator of this system, know Me to be the Non-doer and Eternal.
13.text: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागश: |तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् || 13||
13.transliteration: chātur-varṇyaṁ mayā sṛiṣhṭaṁ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśhaḥtasya kartāram api māṁ viddhyakartāram avyayam

14.meaning: Activities do not taint Me, nor do I desire the fruits of action. One who knows Me in this way is never bound by the karmic reactions of work.
14.text: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते || 14||
14.transliteration: na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛihāiti māṁ yo ’bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate

15.meaning: Knowing this truth, even seekers of liberation in ancient times performed actions. Therefore, following the footsteps of those ancient sages, you too should perform your duty.
15.text: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभि: |कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वै: पूर्वतरं कृतम् || 15||
15.transliteration: evaṁ jñātvā kṛitaṁ karma pūrvair api mumukṣhubhiḥkuru karmaiva tasmāttvaṁ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṁ kṛitam

16.meaning: What is action and what is inaction? Even the wise are confused in determining this. Now I shall explain to you the secret of action, by knowing which, you may free yourself from material bondage.
16.text: किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिता: |तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् || 16||
16.transliteration: kiṁ karma kim akarmeti kavayo ’pyatra mohitāḥtat te karma pravakṣhyāmi yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase ’śhubhāt

17.meaning: You must understand the nature of all three—recommended action, wrong action, and inaction. The truth about these is profound and difficult to understand.
17.text: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मण: |अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गति: || 17||
17.transliteration: karmaṇo hyapi boddhavyaṁ boddhavyaṁ cha vikarmaṇaḥakarmaṇaśh cha boddhavyaṁ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ

18.meaning: Those who see action in inaction and inaction in action are truly wise amongst humans. Although performing all kinds of actions, they are yogis and masters of all their actions.
18.text: कर्मण्यकर्म य: पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म य: |स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्त: कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् || 18||
18.transliteration: karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśhyed akarmaṇi cha karma yaḥsa buddhimān manuṣhyeṣhu sa yuktaḥ kṛitsna-karma-kṛit

19.meaning: The enlightened sages call those persons wise, whose every action is free from the desire for material pleasures and who have burnt the reactions of work in the fire of divine knowledge.
19.text: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भा: कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिता: |ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहु: पण्डितं बुधा: || 19||
19.transliteration: yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma-saṅkalpa-varjitāḥjñānāgni-dagdha-karmāṇaṁ tam āhuḥ paṇḍitaṁ budhāḥ

20.meaning: Such people, having given up attachment to the fruits of their actions, are always satisfied and not dependent on external things. Despite engaging in activities, they do not do anything at all.
20.text: त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रय: |कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति स: || 20||

word_meanings.karma-phala-āsaṅgam: attachment to the fruits of action

20.transliteration: tyaktvā karma-phalāsaṅgaṁ nitya-tṛipto nirāśhrayaḥkarmaṇyabhipravṛitto ’pi naiva kiñchit karoti saḥ

21.meaning: Free from expectations and the sense of ownership, with the mind and intellect fully controlled, they incur no sin even though performing actions by their body.
21.text: निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रह: |शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् || 21||
21.transliteration: nirāśhīr yata-chittātmā tyakta-sarva-parigrahaḥśhārīraṁ kevalaṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham

22.meaning: Content with whatever gain comes of its own accord, and free from envy, they are beyond the dualities of life. Being equipoised in success and failure, they are not bound by their actions, even while performing all kinds of activities.
22.text: यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सर: |सम: सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते || 22||

word_meanings.yadṛichchhā: which comes of its own accord

22.transliteration: yadṛichchhā-lābha-santuṣhṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥsamaḥ siddhāvasiddhau cha kṛitvāpi na nibadhyate

23.meaning: They are released from the bondage of material attachments and their intellect is established in divine knowledge. Since they perform all actions as a sacrifice (to God), they are freed from all karmic reactions.
23.text: गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतस: |यज्ञायाचरत: कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते || 23||
23.transliteration: gata-saṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthita-chetasaḥyajñāyācharataḥ karma samagraṁ pravilīyate

24.meaning: For those who are completely absorbed in God-consciousness, the oblation is Brahman, the ladle with which it is offered is Brahman, the act of offering is Brahman, and the sacrificial fire is also Brahman. Such persons, who view everything as God, easily attain Him.
24.text: ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् |ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना || 24||
24.transliteration: brahmārpaṇaṁ brahma havir brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutambrahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā

25.meaning: Some yogis worship the celestial gods with material offerings unto them. Others worship perfectly who offer the self as sacrifice in the fire of the Supreme Truth.
25.text: दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिन: पर्युपासते |ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति || 25||
25.transliteration: daivam evāpare yajñaṁ yoginaḥ paryupāsatebrahmāgnāvapare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati

26.meaning: Others offer hearing and other senses in the sacrificial fire of restraint. Still others offer sound and other objects of the senses as sacrifice in the fire of the senses.
26.transliteration: śhrotrādīnīndriyāṇyanye sanyamāgniṣhu juhvatiśhabdādīn viṣhayānanya indriyāgniṣhu juhvati

27.meaning: Some, inspired by knowledge, offer the functions of all their senses and their life energy in the fire of the controlled mind.

word_meanings.ātma-sanyama yogāgnau: in the fire of the controlled mind

28.meaning: Some offer their wealth as sacrifice, while others offer severe austerities as sacrifice. Some practice the eight-fold path of yogic practices, and yet others study the scriptures and cultivate knowledge as sacrifice, while observing strict vows.

word_meanings.dravya-yajñāḥ: offering one’s own wealth as sacrifice
word_meanings.yoga-yajñāḥ: performance of eight-fold path of yogic practices as sacrifice
word_meanings.swādhyāya: cultivating knowledge by studying the scriptures
word_meanings.jñāna-yajñāḥ: those offer cultivation of transcendental knowledge as sacrifice

28.transliteration: dravya-yajñās tapo-yajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpareswādhyāya-jñāna-yajñāśh cha yatayaḥ sanśhita-vratāḥ

29.meaning: Still others offer as sacrifice the outgoing breath in the incoming breath, while some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing breath. Some arduously practice
29.text: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे |प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणा: || 29||अपरे नियताहारा: प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति |सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषा: || 30||

word_meanings.yajña-kṣhapita: being cleansed by performances of sacrifices

29.transliteration: apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe ’pānaṁ tathāpareprāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥapare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣhu juhvatisarve ’pyete yajña-vido yajña-kṣhapita-kalmaṣhāḥ

30.meaning: Those who know the secret of sacrifice, and engaging in it, partake of its remnants that are like nectar, advance toward the Absolute Truth. O best of the Kurus, those who perform no sacrifice find no happiness either in this world or the next.
30.text: यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् |नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्य: कुरुसत्तम || 31||

word_meanings.yajña-śhiṣhṭa amṛita-bhujaḥ: they partake of the nectarean remnants of sacrifice
word_meanings.ayajñasya: for one who performs no sacrifice

30.transliteration: yajña-śhiṣhṭāmṛita-bhujo yānti brahma sanātanamnāyaṁ loko ’styayajñasya kuto ’nyaḥ kuru-sattama

31.meaning: All these different kinds of sacrifice have been described in the Vedas. Know them as originating from different types of work; this understanding cuts the knots of material bondage.
31.text: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे |कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे || 32||
31.transliteration: evaṁ bahu-vidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhekarma-jān viddhi tān sarvān evaṁ jñātvā vimokṣhyase

32.meaning: O subduer of enemies, sacrifice performed in knowledge is superior to any mechanical material sacrifice. After all, O Parth, all sacrifices of work culminate in knowledge.
32.text: श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञ: परन्तप |सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते || 33||
32.transliteration: śhreyān dravya-mayād yajñāj jñāna-yajñaḥ parantapasarvaṁ karmākhilaṁ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate

33.meaning: Learn the Truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him with reverence and render service unto him. Such an enlightened Saint can impart knowledge unto you because he has seen the Truth.
33.text: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया |उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिन: || 34||

word_meanings.tattva-darśhinaḥ: those who have realized the truth

33.transliteration: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśhnena sevayāupadekṣhyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśhinaḥ

34.meaning: Following this path and having achieved enlightenment from a Guru, O Arjun, you will no longer fall into delusion. In the light of that knowledge, you will see that all living beings are but parts of the Supreme, and are within Me.
34.text: यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव |येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि || 35||
34.transliteration: yaj jñātvā na punar moham evaṁ yāsyasi pāṇḍavayena bhūtānyaśheṣheṇa drakṣhyasyātmanyatho mayi

35.meaning: Even those who are considered the most immoral of all sinners can cross over this ocean of material existence by seating themselves in the boat of divine knowledge.
35.text: अपि चेदसि पापेभ्य: सर्वेभ्य: पापकृत्तम: |सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि || 36||

word_meanings.jñāna-plavena: by the boat of divine knowledge

35.transliteration: api ched asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa-kṛit-tamaḥsarvaṁ jñāna-plavenaiva vṛijinaṁ santariṣhyasi

36.meaning: As a kindled fire reduces wood to ashes, O Arjun, so does the fire of knowledge burn to ashes all reactions from material activities.
36.transliteration: yathaidhānsi samiddho ’gnir bhasma-sāt kurute ’rjunajñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasma-sāt kurute tathā

37.meaning: In this world, there is nothing as purifying as divine knowledge. One who has attained purity of mind through prolonged practice of Yog, receives such knowledge within the heart, in due course of time.
37.text: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते |तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्ध: कालेनात्मनि विन्दति || 38||
37.transliteration: na hi jñānena sadṛiśhaṁ pavitramiha vidyatetatsvayaṁ yogasansiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati

38.meaning: Those whose faith is deep and who have practiced controlling their mind and senses attain divine knowledge. Through such transcendental knowledge, they quickly attain everlasting supreme peace.
38.text: श्रद्धावान् लभते ज्ञानं तत्पर: संयतेन्द्रिय: |ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति || 39||
38.transliteration: śhraddhāvānllabhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ sanyatendriyaḥjñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śhāntim achireṇādhigachchhati

39.meaning: But persons who possess neither faith nor knowledge, and who are of a doubting nature, suffer a downfall. For the skeptical souls, there is no happiness either in this world or the next.
39.text: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति |नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मन: || 40||
39.transliteration: ajñaśh chāśhraddadhānaśh cha sanśhayātmā vinaśhyatināyaṁ loko ’sti na paro na sukhaṁ sanśhayātmanaḥ

40.meaning: O Arjun, actions do not bind those who have renounced
40.text: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् |आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय || 41||

word_meanings.yoga-sannyasta-karmāṇam: those who renounce ritualistic karm, dedicating their body, mind, and soul to God
word_meanings.ātma-vantam: situated in knowledge of the self

40.transliteration: yoga-sannyasta-karmāṇaṁ jñāna-sañchhinna-sanśhayamātmavantaṁ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya

41.meaning: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubts that have arisen in your heart. O scion of Bharat, establish yourself in
41.text: तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मन: |छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत || 42||
41.transliteration: tasmād ajñāna-sambhūtaṁ hṛit-sthaṁ jñānāsinātmanaḥchhittvainaṁ sanśhayaṁ yogam ātiṣhṭhottiṣhṭha bhārata

1.meaning: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, You praised
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि |यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् || 1||
1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchasannyāsaṁ karmaṇāṁ kṛiṣhṇa punar yogaṁ cha śhansasiyach chhreya etayor ekaṁ tan me brūhi su-niśhchitam

2.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Both the path of
2.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchasannyāsaḥ karma-yogaśh cha niḥśhreyasa-karāvubhautayos tu karma-sannyāsāt karma-yogo viśhiṣhyate

3.text: ज्ञेय: स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ् क्षति |निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते || 3||
3.transliteration: jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣhṭi na kāṅkṣhatinirdvandvo hi mahā-bāho sukhaṁ bandhāt pramuchyate

4.text: साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बाला: प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिता: |एकमप्यास्थित: सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् || 4||
4.transliteration: sānkhya-yogau pṛithag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥekamapyāsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam

5.meaning: The supreme state that is attained by means of
5.text: यत्साङ्ख्यै: प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते |एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च य: पश्यति स पश्यति || 5||
5.transliteration: yat sānkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyateekaṁ sānkhyaṁ cha yogaṁ cha yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati

word_meanings.yoga-yuktaḥ: one who is adept in karm-yog

6.transliteration: sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥyoga-yukto munir brahma na chireṇādhigachchhati

7.text: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रिय: |सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते || 7||

word_meanings.vijita-ātmā: one who has conquered the mind
word_meanings.sarva-bhūta-ātma-bhūta-ātmā: one who sees the Soul of all souls in every living being

7.transliteration: yoga-yukto viśhuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥsarva-bhūtātma-bhūtātmā kurvann api na lipyate

8.meaning: Those steadfast in karm yog, always think, “I am not the doer,” even while engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, moving, sleeping, breathing, speaking, excreting, grasping, and opening or closing the eyes. With the light of divine knowledge, they see that it is only the material senses that are moving amongst their objects.
8.text: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् |पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् || 8||प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्ण्न्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् || 9||
8.transliteration: naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vitpaśhyañ śhṛiṇvan spṛiśhañjighrann aśhnangachchhan svapañśhvasanpralapan visṛijan gṛihṇann unmiṣhan nimiṣhann apiindriyāṇīndriyārtheṣhu vartanta iti dhārayan

9.meaning: Those who dedicate their actions to God, abandoning all attachment, remain untouched by sin, just as a lotus leaf is untouched by water.
9.text: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति य: |लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा || 10||
9.transliteration: brahmaṇyādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā karoti yaḥlipyate na sa pāpena padma-patram ivāmbhasā

10.meaning: The yogis, while giving up attachment, perform actions with their body, senses, mind, and intellect, only for the purpose of self-purification.
10.text: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि |योगिन: कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये || 11||
10.transliteration: kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalair indriyair apiyoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṁ tyaktvātma-śhuddhaye

11.meaning: Offering the results of all activities to God, the
11.text: युक्त: कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् |अयुक्त: कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते || 12||

word_meanings.yuktaḥ: one who is united in consciousness with God
word_meanings.ayuktaḥ: one who is not united with God in consciousness

11.transliteration: yuktaḥ karma-phalaṁ tyaktvā śhāntim āpnoti naiṣhṭhikīmayuktaḥ kāma-kāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate

12.meaning: The embodied beings who are self-controlled and detached reside happily in the city of nine gates free from thoughts that they are the doers or the cause of anything.
12.text: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी |नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् || 13||
12.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhīnava-dvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan

13.meaning: Neither the sense of doership nor the nature of actions comes from God; nor does He create the fruits of actions.  All this is enacted by the modes of material nature (
13.text: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभु: |न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते || 14||
13.transliteration: na kartṛitvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛijati prabhuḥna karma-phala-saṅyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate

14.meaning: The omnipresent God does not involve Himself in the sinful or virtuous deeds of anyone.  The living entities are deluded because their inner knowledge is covered by ignorance.
14.text: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभु: |अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तव: || 15||
14.transliteration: nādatte kasyachit pāpaṁ na chaiva sukṛitaṁ vibhuḥajñānenāvṛitaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ

15.meaning: But for those whose ignorance is destroyed by divine knowledge, the Supreme Entity is revealed, just as the sun illumines everything when it rises.
15.text: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मन: |तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् || 16||
15.transliteration: jñānena tu tad ajñānaṁ yeṣhāṁ nāśhitam ātmanaḥteṣhām āditya-vaj jñānaṁ prakāśhayati tat param

16.meaning: Those whose intellect is fixed in God, who are completely absorbed in God, with firm faith in Him as the supreme goal, such persons quickly reach the state from which there is no return, their sins having been dispelled by the light of knowledge.

word_meanings.tat-buddhayaḥ: those whose intellect is directed toward God
word_meanings.tat-ātmānaḥ: those whose heart (mind and intellect) is solely absorbed in God
word_meanings.tat-niṣhṭhāḥ: those whose intellect has firm faith in God
word_meanings.tat-parāyaṇāḥ: those who strive for God as the supreme goal and refuge

17.meaning: The truly learned, with the eyes of divine knowledge, see with equal vision a Brahmin, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
17.text: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि |शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिता: समदर्शिन: || 18||
17.transliteration: vidyā-vinaya-sampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastiniśhuni chaiva śhva-pāke cha paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśhinaḥ

18.meaning: Those whose minds are established in equality of vision conquer the cycle of birth and death in this very life.  They possess the flawless qualities of God, and are therefore seated in the Absolute Truth.
18.text: इहैव तैर्जित: सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मन: |निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिता: || 19||
18.transliteration: ihaiva tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣhāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥnirdoṣhaṁ hi samaṁ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ

19.meaning: Established in God, having a firm understanding of divine knowledge and not hampered by delusion, they neither rejoice in getting something pleasant nor grieve on experiencing the unpleasant.
19.text: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् |स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थित: || 20||

word_meanings.brahma-vit: having a firm understanding of divine knowledge

19.transliteration: na prahṛiṣhyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya chāpriyamsthira-buddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ

20.meaning: Those who are not attached to external sense pleasures realize divine bliss in the self.  Being united with God through Yog, they experience unending happiness.

word_meanings.brahma-yoga yukta-ātmā: those who are united with God through yog

20.transliteration: bāhya-sparśheṣhvasaktātmā vindatyātmani yat sukhamsa brahma-yoga-yuktātmā sukham akṣhayam aśhnute

21.meaning: The pleasures that arise from contact with the sense objects, though appearing as enjoyable to worldly-minded people, are verily a source of misery.  O son of Kunti, such pleasures have a beginning and an end, so the wise do not delight in them.
21.text: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दु:खयोनय एव ते |आद्यन्तवन्त: कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुध: || 22||

word_meanings.sansparśha-jāḥ: born of contact with the sense objects

21.transliteration: ye hi sansparśha-jā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva teādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣhu ramate budhaḥ

22.meaning: Those persons are yogis, who before giving up the body are able to check the forces of desire and anger; and they alone are happy.
22.text: शक्नोतीहैव य: सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् |कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्त: स सुखी नर: || 23||
22.transliteration: śhaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śharīra-vimokṣhaṇātkāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ

23.meaning: Those who are happy within themselves, enjoying the delight of God within, and are illumined by the inner light, such yogis are united with the Lord and are liberated from material existence.
23.transliteration: yo 'ntaḥ-sukho 'ntar-ārāmas tathāntar-jyotir eva yaḥsa yogī brahma-nirvāṇaṁ brahma-bhūto 'dhigachchhati

24.meaning: Those holy persons, whose sins have been purged, whose doubts are annihilated, whose minds are disciplined, and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain God and are liberated from material existence.
24.text: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषय: क्षीणकल्मषा: |छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मान: सर्वभूतहिते रता: || 25||
24.transliteration: labhante brahma-nirvāṇam ṛiṣhayaḥ kṣhīṇa-kalmaṣhāḥchhinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ

25.text: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् |अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् || 26||

word_meanings.yata-chetasām: those self-realized persons who have subdued their mind

25.transliteration: kāma-krodha-viyuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-chetasāmabhito brahma-nirvāṇaṁ vartate viditātmanām

26.meaning: Shutting out all thoughts of external enjoyment, with the gaze fixed on the space between the eye-brows, equalizing the flow of the incoming and outgoing breath in the nostrils, and thus controlling the senses, mind, and intellect, the sage who becomes free from desire and fear, always lives in freedom.
26.text: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवो: |प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ || 27||यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायण: |विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो य: सदा मुक्त एव स: || 28||
26.transliteration: sparśhān kṛitvā bahir bāhyānśh chakṣhuśh chaivāntare bhruvoḥprāṇāpānau samau kṛitvā nāsābhyantara-chāriṇauyatendriya-mano-buddhir munir mokṣha-parāyaṇaḥvigatechchhā-bhaya-krodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ

27.meaning: Having realized Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds and the selfless friend of all living beings, My devotee attains peace.
27.text: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् |सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति || 29||
27.transliteration: bhoktāraṁ yajña-tapasāṁ sarva-loka-maheśhvaramsuhṛidaṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ jñātvā māṁ śhāntim ṛichchhati

1.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Those who perform prescribed duties without desiring the results of their actions are actual
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अनाश्रित: कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति य: |स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रिय: || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaanāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥsa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ

2.text: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव |न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन || 2||
2.transliteration: yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍavana hyasannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśhchana

3.meaning: To the soul who is aspiring for perfection in Yog, work without attachment is said to be the means; to the sage who is already elevated in Yog, tranquility in meditation is said to be the means.
3.text: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते |योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शम: कारणमुच्यते || 3||

word_meanings.yoga ārūḍhasya: of those who are elevated in Yog

3.transliteration: ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyateyogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate

4.meaning: When one is neither attached to sense objects nor to actions, such a person is said to be elevated in the science of Yog, having renounced all desires for the fruits of actions.
4.text: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते |सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते || 4||

word_meanings.sarva-saṅkalpa: all desires for the fruits of actions
word_meanings.yoga-ārūḍhaḥ: elevated in the science of Yog

4.transliteration: yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv-anuṣhajjatesarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadochyate

5.meaning: Elevate yourself through the power of your mind, and not degrade yourself, for the mind can be the friend and also the enemy of the self.
5.transliteration: uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayetātmaiva hyātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ

6.meaning: For those who have conquered the mind, it is their friend. For those who have failed to do so, the mind works like an enemy.
6.text: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जित: |अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्ते तात्मैव शत्रुवत् || 6||
6.transliteration: bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥanātmanas tu śhatrutve vartetātmaiva śhatru-vat

7.meaning: The yogis who have conquered the mind rise above the dualities of cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and honor and dishonor. Such yogis remain peaceful and steadfast in their devotion to God.
7.text: जितात्मन: प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहित: |शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु तथा मानापमानयो: || 7||

word_meanings.jita-ātmanaḥ: one who has conquered one’s mind

7.transliteration: jitātmanaḥ praśhāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥśhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ

8.meaning: The yogi who are satisfied by knowledge and discrimination, and have conquered their senses, remain undisturbed in all circumstances. They see everything—dirt, stones, and gold—as the same.
8.text: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रिय: |युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: || 8||

word_meanings.vijita-indriyaḥ: one who has conquered the senses
word_meanings.yuktaḥ: one who is in constant communion with the Supreme

8.transliteration: jñāna-vijñāna-tṛiptātmā kūṭa-stho vijitendriyaḥyukta ityuchyate yogī sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ

9.meaning: The yogis look upon all—well-wishers, friends, foes, the pious, and the sinners—with an impartial intellect. The yogi who is of equal intellect toward friend, companion, and foe, neutral among enemies and relatives, and unbiased between the righteous and sinful, is considered to be distinguished among humans.

10.meaning: Those who seek the state of Yog should reside in seclusion, constantly engaged in meditation with a controlled mind and body, getting rid of desires and possessions for enjoyment.
10.text: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थित: |एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रह: || 10||

word_meanings.yata-chitta-ātmā: with a controlled mind and body

10.transliteration: yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥekākī yata-chittātmā nirāśhīr aparigrahaḥ

11.meaning: To practice Yog, one should make an
11.text: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मन: |नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् || 11||
11.transliteration: śhuchau deśhe pratiṣhṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥnātyuchchhritaṁ nāti-nīchaṁ chailājina-kuśhottaram

12.meaning: Seated firmly on it, the yogi should strive to purify the mind by focusing it in meditation with one pointed concentration, controlling all thoughts and activities. He must hold the body, neck, and head firmly in a straight line, and gaze at the tip of the nose, without allowing the eyes to wander.
12.text: तत्रैकाग्रं मन: कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रिय: |उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये || 12||समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिर: |सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् || 13||

word_meanings.nāsika-agram: at the tip of the nose

12.transliteration: tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛitvā yata-chittendriya-kriyaḥupaviśhyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātma-viśhuddhayesamaṁ kāya-śhiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann achalaṁ sthiraḥsamprekṣhya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśhaśh chānavalokayan

13.meaning: Thus, with a serene, fearless, and unwavering mind, and staunch in the vow of celibacy, the vigilant yogi should meditate on Me, having Me alone as the supreme goal.
13.text: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थित: |मन: संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्पर: || 14||

word_meanings.mat-paraḥ: having me as the supreme goal

13.transliteration: praśhāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmachāri-vrate sthitaḥmanaḥ sanyamya mach-chitto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ

14.meaning: Thus, constantly keeping the mind absorbed in Me, the yogi of disciplined mind attains
14.text: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानस: |शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति || 15||

word_meanings.yuñjan: keeping the mind absorbed in God

14.transliteration: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥśhāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ mat-sansthām adhigachchhati

15.meaning: O Arjun, those who eat too much or too little, sleep too much or too little, cannot attain success in Yog.
15.text: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नत: |न चाति स्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन || 16||

word_meanings.jāgrataḥ: one who does not sleep enough

15.transliteration: nātyaśhnatastu yogo ’sti na chaikāntam anaśhnataḥna chāti-svapna-śhīlasya jāgrato naiva chārjuna

16.meaning: But those who are temperate in eating and recreation, balanced in work, and regulated in sleep, can mitigate all sorrows by practicing Yog.
16.text: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु |युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दु:खहा || 17||
16.transliteration: yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-cheṣhṭasya karmasuyukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā

17.meaning: With thorough discipline, they learn to withdraw the mind from selfish cravings and rivet it on the unsurpassable good of the self. Such persons are said to be in Yog, and are free from all yearning of the senses.
17.text: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते |नि:स्पृह: सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा || 18||
17.transliteration: yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmanyevāvatiṣhṭhateniḥspṛihaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ityuchyate tadā

18.meaning: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the disciplined mind of a yogi
18.text: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता |योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मन: || 19||
18.transliteration: yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛitāyogino yata-chittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ

19.meaning: When the mind, restrained from material activities, becomes still by the practice of Yog, then the yogi is able to behold the soul through the purified mind, and he rejoices in the inner joy.
19.text: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया |यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति || 20||
19.transliteration: yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayāyatra chaivātmanātmānaṁ paśhyann ātmani tuṣhyati

20.meaning: In that joyous state of Yog, called
20.text: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् |वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वत: || 21||
20.transliteration: sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyamvetti yatra na chaivāyaṁ sthitaśh chalati tattvataḥ

21.meaning: Having gained that state, one does not consider any attainment to be greater. Being thus established, one is not shaken even in the midst of the greatest calamity.
21.text: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं तत: |यस्मिन्स्थितो न दु:खेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते || 22||
21.transliteration: yaṁ labdhvā chāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥyasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vichālyate

22.meaning: That state of severance from union with misery is known as Yog. This Yog should be resolutely practiced with determination free from pessimism.
22.text: तं विद्याद् दु:खसंयोगवियोगं योगसञ्ज्ञितम् |स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा || 23||

word_meanings.duḥkha-sanyoga-viyogam: state of severance from union with misery

22.transliteration: taṁ vidyād duḥkha-sanyoga-viyogaṁ yogasaṅjñitamsa niśhchayena yoktavyo yogo ’nirviṇṇa-chetasā

23.meaning: Completely renouncing all desires arising from thoughts of the world, one should restrain the senses from all sides with the mind. Slowly and steadily, with conviction in the intellect, the mind will become fixed in God alone, and will think of nothing else.
23.text: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषत: |मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्तत: || 24||शनै: शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया |आत्मसंस्थं मन: कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् || 25||

word_meanings.dhṛiti-gṛihītayā: achieved through determination of resolve that is in accordance with scriptures

23.transliteration: saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāns tyaktvā sarvān aśheṣhataḥmanasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥśhanaiḥ śhanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛiti-gṛihītayāātma-sansthaṁ manaḥ kṛitvā na kiñchid api chintayet

24.meaning: Whenever and wherever the restless and unsteady mind wanders, one should bring it back and continually focus it on God.
24.text: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् |ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् || 26||
24.transliteration: yato yato niśhcharati manaśh chañchalam asthiramtatas tato niyamyaitad ātmanyeva vaśhaṁ nayet

25.meaning: Great transcendental happiness comes to the yogi whose mind is calm, whose passions are subdued, who is without sin, and who sees everything in connection with God.
25.text: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् |उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् || 27||
25.transliteration: praśhānta-manasaṁ hyenaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamamupaiti śhānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣham

26.meaning: The self-controlled yogi, thus uniting the self with God, becomes free from material contamination, and being in constant touch with the Supreme, achieves the highest state of perfect happiness.
26.text: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मष: |सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते || 28||

word_meanings.brahma-sansparśham: constantly in touch with the Supreme

26.transliteration: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥsukhena brahma-sansparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute

27.meaning: The true yogis, uniting their consciousness with God, see with equal eye, all living beings in God and God in all living beings.
27.text: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि |ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शन: || 29||

word_meanings.yoga-yukta-ātmā: one united in consciousness with God

27.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmaniīkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ

28.meaning: For those who see Me everywhere and see all things in Me, I am never lost, nor are they ever lost to Me.
28.text: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति |तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति || 30||
28.transliteration: yo māṁ paśhyati sarvatra sarvaṁ cha mayi paśhyatitasyāhaṁ na praṇaśhyāmi sa cha me na praṇaśhyati

29.meaning: The yogi who is established in union with Me, and worships Me as the Supreme Soul residing in all beings, dwells only in Me, though engaged in all kinds of activities.
29.text: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थित: |सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते || 31||
29.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajatyekatvam āsthitaḥsarvathā vartamāno ’pi sa yogī mayi vartate

30.meaning: I regard them to be perfect yogis who see the true equality of all living beings and respond to the joys and sorrows of others as if they were their own.
30.text: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन |सुखं वा यदि वा दु:खं स योगी परमो मत: || 32||
30.transliteration: ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo ’rjunasukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ

31.meaning: Arjun said: The system of Yog that you have described, O Madhusudan, appears impractical and unattainable to me, due to the restless mind.
31.text: अर्जुन उवाच |योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्त: साम्येन मधुसूदन |एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् || 33||

word_meanings.madhu-sūdana: Shree Krishna, the killer of the demon named Madhu

31.transliteration: arjuna uvāchayo ’yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdanaetasyāhaṁ na paśhyāmi chañchalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām

32.meaning: The mind is very restless, turbulent, strong and obstinate, O Krishna. It appears to me that it is more difficult to control than the wind.
32.text: चञ्चलं हि मन: कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् |तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् || 34||
32.transliteration: chañchalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛiṣhṇa pramāthi balavad dṛiḍhamtasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva su-duṣhkaram

33.meaning: Lord Krishna said: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, what you say is correct; the mind is indeed very difficult to restrain. But by practice and detachment, it can be controlled.
33.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् |अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते || 35||
33.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaasanśhayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ chalamabhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa cha gṛihyate

34.meaning: Yog is difficult to attain for one whose mind is unbridled. However, those who have learnt to control the mind, and who strive earnestly by proper means, can attain perfection in Yog. This is My opinion.
34.text: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मति: |वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायत: || 36||

word_meanings.vaśhya-ātmanā: by one whose mind is controlled

34.transliteration: asaṅyatātmanā yogo duṣhprāpa iti me matiḥvaśhyātmanā tu yatatā śhakyo ’vāptum upāyataḥ

35.meaning: Arjun said: What is the fate of the unsuccessful yogi who begins the path with faith, but who does not endeavor sufficiently due to an unsteady mind and is unable to reach the goal of Yog in this life?
35.text: अर्जुन उवाच |अयति: श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानस: |अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति || 37||
35.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaayatiḥ śhraddhayopeto yogāch chalita-mānasaḥaprāpya yoga-sansiddhiṁ kāṅ gatiṁ kṛiṣhṇa gachchhati

36.meaning: Does not such a person who deviates from Yog get deprived of both material and spiritual success, O mighty-armed Krishna, and perish like a broken cloud with no position in either sphere?
36.text: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति |अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मण: पथि || 38||
36.transliteration: kachchin nobhaya-vibhraṣhṭaśh chhinnābhram iva naśhyatiapratiṣhṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi

37.meaning: O Krishna, please dispel this doubt of mine completely, for who other than You can do so?
37.text: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषत: |त्वदन्य: संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते || 39||
37.transliteration: etan me sanśhayaṁ kṛiṣhṇa chhettum arhasyaśheṣhataḥtvad-anyaḥ sanśhayasyāsya chhettā na hyupapadyate

38.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: O Parth, one who engages on the spiritual path does not meet with destruction either in this world or the world to come. My dear friend, one who strives for God-realization is never overcome by evil.
38.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते |न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति || 40||
38.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchapārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśhas tasya vidyatena hi kalyāṇa-kṛit kaśhchid durgatiṁ tāta gachchhati

39.meaning: The unsuccessful yogis, upon death, go to the abodes of the virtuous. After dwelling there for many ages, they are again reborn in the earth plane, into a family of pious and prosperous people. Else, if they had developed dispassion due to long practice of Yog, they are born into a family endowed with divine wisdom. Such a birth is very difficult to attain in this world.
39.text: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वती: समा: |शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते || 41||अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् |एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् || 42||

word_meanings.yoginām: of those endowed with divine wisdom

39.transliteration: prāpya puṇya-kṛitāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśhvatīḥ samāḥśhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo ’bhijāyateatha vā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatāmetad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛiśham

40.meaning: On taking such a birth, O descendant of Kurus, they reawaken the wisdom of their previous lives, and strive even harder toward perfection in Yog.
40.text: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् |यतते च ततो भूय: संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन || 43||
40.transliteration: tatra taṁ buddhi-sanyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikamyatate cha tato bhūyaḥ sansiddhau kuru-nandana

41.meaning: Indeed, they feel drawn toward God, even against their will, on the strength of their past discipline. Such seekers naturally rise above the ritualistic principles of the scriptures.
41.text: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि स: |जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते || 44||
41.transliteration: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśho ’pi saḥjijñāsur api yogasya śhabda-brahmātivartate

42.meaning: With the accumulated merits of many past births, when these yogis engage in sincere endeavors to make further progress, they become purified from material desires and attain perfection in this life itself.
42.text: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिष: |अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् || 45||
42.transliteration: prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī sanśhuddha-kilbiṣhaḥaneka-janma-sansiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim

43.meaning: A yogi is superior to the
43.transliteration: tapasvibhyo ’dhiko yogījñānibhyo ’pi mato ’dhikaḥkarmibhyaśh chādhiko yogītasmād yogī bhavārjuna

44.meaning: Of all yogis, those whose minds are always absorbed in Me, and who engage in devotion to Me with great faith, them I consider to be the highest of all.
44.text: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना |श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मत: || 47||
44.transliteration: yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntar-ātmanāśhraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ

1.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Now listen, O Arjun, how, with the mind attached exclusively to Me, and surrendering to Me through the practice of
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय: |असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchamayyāsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥasanśhayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tach chhṛiṇu

2.meaning: I shall now reveal unto you fully this knowledge and wisdom, knowing which nothing else remains to be known in this world.
2.text: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत: |यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते || 2||
2.transliteration: jñānaṁ te ’haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmyaśheṣhataḥyaj jñātvā neha bhūyo ’nyaj jñātavyam-avaśhiṣhyate

3.meaning: Amongst thousands of persons, hardly one strives for perfection; and amongst those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
3.text: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये |यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वत: || 3||

word_meanings.siddhānām: of those who have achieved perfection

3.transliteration: manuṣhyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśhchid yatati siddhayeyatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśhchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ

4.meaning: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intellect, and ego—these are eight components of My material energy.
4.text: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायु: खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च |अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा || 4||
4.transliteration: bhūmir-āpo ’nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva chaahankāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛitir aṣhṭadhā

5.meaning: Such is My inferior energy. But beyond it, O mighty-armed Arjun, I have a superior energy. This is the
5.text: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् |जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् || 5||
5.transliteration: apareyam itas tvanyāṁ prakṛitiṁ viddhi me parāmjīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat

6.meaning: Know that all living beings are manifested by these two energies of Mine. I am the source of the entire creation, and into Me it again dissolves.
6.text: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय |अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगत: प्रभव: प्रलयस्तथा || 6||

word_meanings.etat yonīni: these two (energies) are the source of

6.transliteration: etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhārayaahaṁ kṛitsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā

7.meaning: There is nothing higher than Myself, O Arjun. Everything rests in Me, as beads strung on a thread.
7.text: मत्त: परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय |मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव || 7||
7.transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjayamayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva

8.meaning: I am the taste in water, O son of Kunti, and the radiance of the sun and the moon. I am the sacred syllable Om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether, and the ability in humans.
8.text: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययो: |प्रणव: सर्ववेदेषु शब्द: खे पौरुषं नृषु || 8||

word_meanings.śhaśhi-sūryayoḥ: of the moon and the sun

8.transliteration: raso ’ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśhi-sūryayoḥpraṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛiṣhu

9.meaning: I am the pure fragrance of the Earth, and the brilliance in fire. I am the life-force in all beings, and the penance of the ascetics.
9.text: पुण्यो गन्ध: पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ |जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु || 9||
9.transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛithivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasaujīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu

10.meaning: O Arjun, know that I am the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intellect of the intelligent, and the splendor of the glorious.
10.text: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् |बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् || 10||
10.transliteration: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanambuddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham

11.meaning: O best of the Bharatas, in strong persons, I am their strength devoid of desire and passion. I am sexual activity not conflicting with virtue or scriptural injunctions.
11.text: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् |धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ || 11||

word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: Arjun, the best of the Bharats

11.transliteration: balaṁ balavatāṁ chāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitamdharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo ’smi bharatarṣhabha

12.meaning: The three states of material existence—goodness, passion, and ignorance—are manifested by My energy. They are in Me, but I am beyond them.
12.text: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये |मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि || 12||
12.transliteration: ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha yematta eveti tān viddhi na tvahaṁ teṣhu te mayi

13.meaning: Deluded by the three modes of Maya, people in this world are unable to know Me, the imperishable and eternal.
13.text: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभि: सर्वमिदं जगत् |मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्य: परमव्ययम् || 13||

word_meanings.guṇa-mayaiḥ: consisting of the modes of material nature

13.transliteration: tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagatmohitaṁ nābhijānāti māmebhyaḥ param avyayam

14.meaning: My divine energy Maya, consisting of the three modes of nature, is very difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me cross over it easily.
14.text: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया |मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते || 14||

word_meanings.guṇa-mayī: consisting of the three modes of nature

14.transliteration: daivī hyeṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayāmām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te

15.meaning: Four kinds of people do not surrender unto Me—those ignorant of knowledge, those who lazily follow their lower nature though capable of knowing Me, those with deluded intellect, and those with a demoniac nature.
15.text: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढा: प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमा: |माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिता: || 15||

word_meanings.nara-adhamāḥ: one who lazily follows one’s lower nature
