15.transliteration: na māṁ duṣhkṛitino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥmāyayāpahṛita-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśhritāḥ

16.meaning: O best amongst the Bharatas, four kinds of pious people engage in My devotion—the distressed, the seekers of knowledge, the seekers of worldly possessions, and those who are situated in knowledge.
16.text: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जना: सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन |आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ || 16||

word_meanings.jñānī: those who are situated in knowledge
word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: The best amongst the Bharatas, Arjun

16.transliteration: chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛitino ’rjunaārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha

17.meaning: Amongst these, I consider them to be the highest, who worship Me with knowledge, and are steadfastly and exclusively devoted to Me. I am very dear to them and they are very dear to Me.
17.text: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते |प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रिय: || 17||

word_meanings.jñānī: those who are situated in knowledge

17.transliteration: teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśhiṣhyatepriyo hi jñānino ’tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ

18.meaning: All those who are devoted to Me are indeed noble. But those in knowledge, who are of steadfast mind, whose intellect is merged in Me, and who have made Me alone as their supreme goal, I consider as My very self.
18.text: उदारा: सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् |आस्थित: स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् || 18||
18.transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matamāsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim

19.meaning: After many births of spiritual practice, one who is endowed with knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be all that is. Such a great soul is indeed very rare.
19.text: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते |वासुदेव: सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभ: || 19||

word_meanings.jñāna-vān: one who is endowed with knowledge
word_meanings.vāsudevaḥ: Shree Krishna, the son of Vasudev

19.transliteration: bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyatevāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ

20.meaning: Those whose knowledge has been carried away by material desires surrender to the celestial gods. Following their own nature, they worship the
20.text: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञाना: प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवता: |तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियता: स्वया || 20||

word_meanings.hṛita-jñānāḥ: whose knowledge has been carried away

20.transliteration: kāmais tais tair hṛita-jñānāḥ prapadyante ’nya-devatāḥtaṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛityā niyatāḥ svayā

21.meaning: Whatever celestial form a devotee seeks to worship with faith, I steady the faith of such a devotee in that form.
21.text: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्त: श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति |तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् || 21||
21.transliteration: yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārchitum ichchhatitasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmyaham

22.meaning: Endowed with faith, the devotee worships a particular celestial god and obtains the objects of desire. But in reality, I alone arrange these benefits.
22.text: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते |लभते च तत: कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् || 22||
22.transliteration: sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhatelabhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān

23.meaning: But the fruit gained by these people of little understanding is perishable. Those who worship the celestial gods go to the celestial abodes, while My devotees come to Me.
23.text: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् |देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि || 23||

word_meanings.deva-yajaḥ: the worshipers of the celestial gods

23.transliteration: antavat tu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavatyalpa-medhasāmdevān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api

24.meaning: The less intelligent think that I, the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna, was formless earlier and have now assumed this personality. They do not understand the imperishable exalted nature of My personal form.
24.text: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धय: |परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् || 24||
24.transliteration: avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥparaṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam

25.meaning: I am not manifest to everyone, being veiled by My divine
25.text: नाहं प्रकाश: सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृत: |मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् || 25||
25.transliteration: nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛitaḥmūḍho ’yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam

26.meaning: O Arjun, I know of past, present, and future, and I also know all living beings; but Me no one knows.
26.text: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन |भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन || 26||
26.transliteration: vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjunabhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana

27.meaning: O descendant of Bharat, the dualities of desire and aversion arise from illusion. O conqueror of enemies, all living beings in the material realm are deluded by these.
27.text: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत |सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप || 27||
27.transliteration: ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhāratasarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa

28.meaning: But persons, whose sins have been destroyed by engaging in pious activities, become free from the illusion of dualities. Such persons worship Me with determination.
28.text: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् |ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रता: || 28||
28.transliteration: yeṣhāṁ tvanta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇāmte dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛiḍha-vratāḥ

29.meaning: Those who take shelter in Me, striving for liberation from old-age and death, come to know the Brahman, the individual self, and the entire field of karmic action.
29.text: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये |ते ब्रह्म तद्विदु: कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् || 29||
29.transliteration: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti yete brahma tadviduḥ kṛitsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam

30.meaning: Those who know Me as the governing principle of the
30.text: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदु: |प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतस: || 30||

word_meanings.sa-adhibhūta: governing principle of the field of matter
word_meanings.adhidaivam: governing principle of the celestial gods
word_meanings.sa-adhiyajñam: governing principle of the Lord of all sacrificial performances

30.transliteration: sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥprayāṇa-kāle ’pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ

1.meaning: Arjun said: O Supreme Lord, what is Brahman (Absolute Reality), what is
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम |अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते || 1||अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन |प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: || 2||

word_meanings.puruṣha-uttama: Shree Krishna, the Supreme Divine Personality
word_meanings.adhidaivam: the Lord of the celestial gods
word_meanings.madhusūdana: Shree Krishna, the killer of the demon named Madhu

1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchakiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣhottamaadhibhūtaṁ cha kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim uchyateadhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko ’tra dehe ’smin madhusūdanaprayāṇa-kāle cha kathaṁ jñeyo ’si niyatātmabhiḥ

2.meaning: The Lord said: The Supreme Indestructible Entity is called Brahman; one’s own self is called
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते |भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्ग: कर्मसञ्ज्ञित: || 3||

word_meanings.bhūta-bhāva-udbhava-karaḥ: actions pertaining to the material personality of living beings, and its development

2.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaakṣharaṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo ’dhyātmam uchyatebhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-sanjñitaḥ

3.meaning: O best of the embodied souls, the physical manifestation that is constantly changing is called
3.text: अधिभूतं क्षरो भाव: पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् |अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर || 4||

word_meanings.puruṣhaḥ: the cosmic personality of God, encompassing the material creation
word_meanings.adhidaivatam: the Lord of the celestial gods

3.transliteration: adhibhūtaṁ kṣharo bhāvaḥ puruṣhaśh chādhidaivatamadhiyajño ’ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛitāṁ vara

4.meaning: Those who relinquish the body while remembering Me at the moment of death will come to Me. There is certainly no doubt about this.
4.text: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् |य: प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशय: || 5||
4.transliteration: anta-kāle cha mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaramyaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāstyatra sanśhayaḥ

5.meaning: Whatever one remembers upon giving up the body at the time of death, O son of Kunti, one attains that state, being always absorbed in such contemplation.
5.text: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् |तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावित: || 6||
5.transliteration: yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajatyante kalevaramtaṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ

6.meaning: Therefore, always remember Me and also do your duty of fighting the war.  With mind and intellect surrendered to Me, you will definitely attain Me; of this, there is no doubt.
6.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu mām anusmara yudhya chamayyarpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣhyasyasanśhayam

7.meaning: With practice, O Parth, when you constantly engage the mind in remembering Me, the Supreme Divine Personality, without deviating, you will certainly attain Me.
7.text: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना |परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् || 8||
7.transliteration: abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena chetasā nānya-gāmināparamaṁ puruṣhaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānuchintayan

8.meaning: God is Omniscient, the most ancient One, the Controller, subtler than the subtlest, the Support of all, and the possessor of an inconceivable divine form; He is brighter than the sun, and beyond all darkness of ignorance.  One who at the time of death, with unmoving mind attained by the practice of Yog, fixes the
8.text: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: |सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् || 9||प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेनभक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव |भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् || 10||
8.transliteration: kaviṁ purāṇam anuśhāsitāramaṇor aṇīyānsam anusmared yaḥsarvasya dhātāram achintya-rūpamāditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastātprayāṇa-kāle manasāchalenabhaktyā yukto yoga-balena chaivabhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśhya samyaksa taṁ paraṁ puruṣham upaiti divyam

9.meaning: Scholars of the Vedas describe Him as Imperishable; great ascetics practice the vow of celibacy and renounce worldly pleasures to enter into Him.  I shall now explain to you briefly the path to that goal.
9.text: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्तिविशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागा: |यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्तितत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये || 11||
9.transliteration: yad akṣharaṁ veda-vido vadantiviśhanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥyad ichchhanto brahmacharyaṁ charantitat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣhye

10.meaning: Restraining all the gates of the body and fixing the mind in the heart region, and then drawing the life-breath to the head, one should get established in steadfast yogic concentration.
10.text: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च |मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मन: प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् || 12||
10.transliteration: sarva-dvārāṇi sanyamya mano hṛidi nirudhya chamūrdhnyādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām

11.meaning: One who departs from the body while remembering Me, the Supreme Personality, and chanting the syllable Om, will attain the supreme goal.
11.text: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् |य: प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् || 13||

word_meanings.om: sacred syllable representing the formless aspect of God

11.transliteration: oṁ ityekākṣharaṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaranyaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim

12.meaning: O Parth, for those yogis who always think of Me with exclusive devotion, I am easily attainable because of their constant absorption in Me.
12.text: अनन्यचेता: सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यश: |तस्याहं सुलभ: पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिन: || 14||
12.transliteration: ananya-chetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśhaḥtasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ

13.meaning: Having attained Me, the great souls are no more subject to rebirth in this world, which is transient and full of misery, because they have attained the highest perfection.
13.text: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दु:खालयमशाश्वतम् |नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मान: संसिद्धिं परमां गता: || 15||
13.transliteration: mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśhāśhvatamnāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ sansiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ

14.meaning: In all the worlds of this material creation, up to the highest abode of Brahma, you will be subject to rebirth, O Arjun.  But on attaining My Abode, O son of Kunti, there is no further rebirth.
14.text: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोका: पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन |मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते || 16||

word_meanings.ā-brahma-bhuvanāt: up to the abode of Brahma

14.transliteration: ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino ’rjunamām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate

word_meanings.ahaḥ-rātra-vidaḥ: those who know this day and night

15.transliteration: sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥrātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te ’ho-rātra-vido janāḥ

16.meaning: At the advent of Brahma’s day, all living beings emanate from the unmanifest source.  And at the fall of his night, all embodied beings again merge into their unmanifest source.

word_meanings.ahaḥ-āgame: at the advent of Brahma’s day
word_meanings.rātri-āgame: at the fall of Brahma’s night
word_meanings.avyakta-sanjñake: in that which is called the unmanifest

16.transliteration: avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavantyahar-āgamerātryāgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-sanjñake

17.meaning: Multitudes of beings repeatedly take birth with the advent of Brahma’s day, and are reabsorbed on the arrival of the cosmic night, to manifest again automatically on the advent of the next cosmic day.
17.text: भूतग्राम: स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते |रात्र्यागमेऽवश: पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे || 19||
17.transliteration: bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyaterātryāgame ’vaśhaḥ pārtha prabhavatyahar-āgame

18.meaning: Transcendental to this manifest and unmanifest creation, there is yet another unmanifest eternal dimension.  That realm does not cease even when all others do.
18.text: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातन: |य: स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति || 20||
18.transliteration: paras tasmāt tu bhāvo ’nyo ’vyakto ’vyaktāt sanātanaḥyaḥ sa sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu naśhyatsu na vinaśhyati

19.meaning: That unmanifest dimension is the supreme goal, and upon reaching it, one never returns to this mortal world.  That is My Supreme Abode.
19.text: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहु: परमां गतिम् |यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम || 21||
19.transliteration: avyakto ’kṣhara ityuktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatimyaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama

20.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality is greater than all that exists.  Although He is all-pervading and all living beings are situated in Him, yet He can be known only through devotion.
20.text: पुरुष: स पर: पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया |यस्यान्त:स्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् || 22||
20.transliteration: puruṣhaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tvananyayāyasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam

21.meaning: I shall now describe to you the different paths of passing away from this world, O best of the Bharatas, one of which leads to liberation and the other leads to rebirth.  Those who know the Supreme Brahman and who depart from this world, during the six months of the sun’s northern course, the bright fortnight of the moon, and the bright part of the day, attain the supreme destination.  The practitioners of Vedic rituals, who pass away during the six months of the sun’s southern course, the dark fortnight of the moon, the time of smoke, the night, attain the celestial abodes.  After enjoying celestial pleasures, they again return to the earth.  These two, bright and dark paths, always exist in this world.  The way of light leads to liberation and the way of darkness leads to rebirth.
21.text: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिन: |प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ || 23||अग्निर्ज्योतिरह: शुक्ल: षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् |तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जना: || 24||धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्ण: षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् |तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते || 25||शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगत: शाश्वते मते |एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुन: || 26||

word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: Arjun, the best of the Bharatas
word_meanings.śhuklaḥ: the bright fortnight of the moon
word_meanings.kṛiṣhṇaḥ: the dark fortnight of the moon

21.transliteration: yatra kāle tvanāvṛittim āvṛittiṁ chaiva yoginaḥprayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣhyāmi bharatarṣhabhaagnir jyotir ahaḥ śhuklaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇamtatra prayātā gachchhanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥdhūmo rātris tathā kṛiṣhṇaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā dakṣhiṇāyanamtatra chāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartateśhukla-kṛiṣhṇe gatī hyete jagataḥ śhāśhvate mateekayā yātyanāvṛittim anyayāvartate punaḥ

22.meaning: Yogis who know the secret of these two paths, O Parth, are never bewildered.  Therefore, at all times be situated in Yog (union with God).
22.text: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन |तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन || 27||
22.transliteration: naite sṛitī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaśhchanatasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna

23.meaning: The yogis, who know this secret, gain merit far beyond the fruits of Vedic rituals, the study of the Vedas, performance of sacrifices, austerities, and charities.  Such yogis reach the Supreme Abode.
23.text: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तप:सु चैवदानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् |अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वायोगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् || 28||

word_meanings.vedeṣhu: in the study of the Vedas

23.transliteration: vedeṣhu yajñeṣhu tapaḥsu chaivadāneṣhu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣhṭamatyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvāyogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti chādyam

1.meaning: The Supreme Lord said:  O Arjun, because you are not envious of Me, I shall now impart to you this very confidential knowledge and wisdom, upon knowing which you will be released from the miseries of material existence.
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे |ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchaidaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣhyāmyanasūyavejñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase ’śhubhāt

2.meaning: This knowledge is the king of sciences and the most profound of all secrets.  It purifies those who hear it.  It is directly realizable, in accordance with
2.text: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् |प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् || 2||
2.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamampratyakṣhāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ su-sukhaṁ kartum avyayam

3.meaning: People who have no faith in this
3.text: अश्रद्दधाना: पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप |अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि || 3||
3.transliteration: aśhraddadhānāḥ puruṣhā dharmasyāsya parantapaaprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛityu-samsāra-vartmani

4.meaning: This entire cosmic manifestation is pervaded by Me in My unmanifest form.  All living beings dwell in Me, but I do not dwell in them.
4.text: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना |मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थित: || 4||
4.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtināmat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na chāhaṁ teṣhvavasthitaḥ

5.meaning: And yet, the living beings do not abide in Me.  Behold the mystery of My divine energy!  Although I am the Creator and Sustainer of all living beings, I am not influenced by them or by material nature.
5.text: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् |भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावन: || 5||

word_meanings.bhūta-bhṛit: the sustainer of all living beings

5.transliteration: na cha mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśhya me yogam aiśhwarambhūta-bhṛin na cha bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ

6.meaning: Know that as the mighty wind blowing everywhere rests always in the sky, likewise all living beings always rest in Me.
6.text: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायु: सर्वत्रगो महान् |तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय || 6||
6.transliteration: yathākāśha-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahāntathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānītyupadhāraya

7.text: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् |कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् || 7||प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुन: पुन: |भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् || 8||

word_meanings.kalpa-kṣhaye: at the end of a kalpa
word_meanings.kalpa-ādau: at the beginning of a kalpa

7.transliteration: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛitiṁ yānti māmikāmkalpa-kṣhaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛijāmyahamprakṛitiṁ svām avaṣhṭabhya visṛijāmi punaḥ punaḥbhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛitsnam avaśhaṁ prakṛiter vaśhāt

8.meaning: O conqueror of wealth, none of these actions bind Me.  I remain like a neutral observer, ever detached from these actions.
8.text: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय |उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु || 9||
8.transliteration: na cha māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjayaudāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣhu karmasu

9.meaning: Working under My direction, this material energy brings into being all animate and inanimate forms, O son of Kunti.  For this reason, the material world undergoes the changes (of creation, maintenance, and dissolution).
9.text: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृति: सूयते सचराचरम् |हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते || 10||
9.transliteration: mayādhyakṣheṇa prakṛitiḥ sūyate sa-charācharamhetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate

10.meaning: When I descend in My personal form deluded persons are unable to recognize Me.  They do not know the divinity of My personality, as the Supreme Lord of all beings.
10.text: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् |परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् || 11||
10.transliteration: avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣhīṁ tanum āśhritamparaṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram

11.meaning: Bewildered by the material energy, such persons embrace demoniac and atheistic views.  In that deluded state, their hopes for welfare are in vain, their fruitive actions are wasted, and their culture of knowledge is baffled.
11.text: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतस: |राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिता: || 12||
11.transliteration: moghāśhā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vichetasaḥrākṣhasīm āsurīṁ chaiva prakṛitiṁ mohinīṁ śhritāḥ

12.meaning: But the great souls, who take shelter of My divine energy, O Parth, know Me, Lord Krishna, as the origin of all creation.  They engage in My devotion with their minds fixed exclusively on Me.
12.text: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिता: |भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् || 13||
12.transliteration: mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛitim āśhritāḥbhajantyananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam

13.meaning: Always singing My divine glories, striving with great determination, and humbly bowing down before Me, they constantly worship Me in loving devotion.
13.text: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रता: |नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते || 14||
13.transliteration: satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaśh cha dṛiḍha-vratāḥnamasyantaśh cha māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate

14.text: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते |एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् || 15||
14.transliteration: jñāna-yajñena chāpyanye yajanto mām upāsateekatvena pṛithaktvena bahudhā viśhvato-mukham

15.meaning: It is I who am the Vedic ritual, I am the sacrifice, and I am the oblation offered to the ancestors.  I am the medicinal herb, and I am the Vedic mantra.  I am the clarified butter, I am the fire and the act of offering.  Of this universe, I am the Father; I am also the Mother, the Sustainer, and the Grandsire.  I am the purifier, the goal of knowledge, the sacred syllable Om.  I am the Ṛig Veda, Sāma Veda, and the Yajur Veda.
15.text: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञ: स्वधाहमहमौषधम् |मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् || 16||पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामह: |वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च || 17||
15.transliteration: ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣhadhammantro ’ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutampitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥvedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛik sāma yajur eva cha

16.meaning: I am the Supreme Goal of all living beings, and I am also their Sustainer, Master, Witness, Abode, Shelter, and Friend.  I am the Origin, End, and Resting Place of creation; I am the Repository and Eternal Seed.
16.text: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभु: साक्षी निवास: शरणं सुहृत् |प्रभव: प्रलय: स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् || 18||
16.transliteration: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣhī nivāsaḥ śharaṇaṁ suhṛitprabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam

17.meaning: I radiate heat as the sun, and I withhold, as well as send forth rain.  I am immortality as well as death personified, O Arjun.  I am the spirit as well as matter.
17.text: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णम्युत्सृजामि च |अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन || 19||
17.transliteration: tapāmyaham ahaṁ varṣhaṁ nigṛihṇāmyutsṛijāmi chaamṛitaṁ chaiva mṛityuśh cha sad asach chāham arjuna

18.meaning: Those who are inclined to the fruitive activity described in the Vedas worship Me through ritualistic sacrifices.  Being purified from sin by drinking the
18.text: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपा: पूतपापायज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते |ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् || 20||

word_meanings.trai-vidyāḥ: the science of karm kāṇḍ (Vedic rituals)
word_meanings.svaḥ-gatim: way to the abode of the king of heaven
word_meanings.deva-bhogān: the pleasures of the celestial gods

18.transliteration: trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpāyajñair iṣhṭvā svar-gatiṁ prārthayantete puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokamaśhnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān

19.meaning: When they have enjoyed the vast pleasures of heaven, the stock of their merits being exhausted, they return to the earthly plane.  Thus, those who follow the Vedic rituals, desiring objects of enjoyment, repeatedly come and go in this world.
19.text: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालंक्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति |एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्नागतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते || 21||

word_meanings.trayī dharmam: the karm-kāṇḍ portion of the three Vedas

19.transliteration: te taṁ bhuktvā swarga-lokaṁ viśhālaṁkṣhīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśhantievaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannāgatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante

20.meaning: There are those who always think of Me and engage in exclusive devotion to Me.  To them, whose minds are always absorbed in Me, I provide what they lack and preserve what they already possess.
20.text: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जना: पर्युपासते |तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् || 22||
20.transliteration: ananyāśh chintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsateteṣhāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣhemaṁ vahāmyaham

21.meaning: O son of Kunti, even those devotees who faithfully worship other gods also worship Me.  But they do so by the wrong method.
21.text: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: |तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् || 23||
21.transliteration: ye ’pyanya-devatā-bhaktā yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥte ’pi mām eva kaunteya yajantyavidhi-pūrvakam

22.meaning: I am the enjoyer and the only Lord of all sacrifices.  But those who fail to realize My divine nature must be reborn.
22.text: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च |न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते || 24||
22.transliteration: ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā cha prabhureva chana tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaśh chyavanti te

23.meaning: Worshippers of the celestial gods take birth amongst the celestial gods, worshippers of the ancestors go to the ancestors, worshippers of ghosts take birth amongst such beings, and My devotees come to Me alone.
23.text: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄ न्यान्ति पितृव्रता: |भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||25||
23.transliteration: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝīn yānti pitṛi-vratāḥbhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino ’pi mām

24.meaning: If one offers to Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or even water, I delightfully partake of that item offered with love by My devotee in pure consciousness.
24.text: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति |तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मन: || 26||
24.transliteration: patraṁ puṣhpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayachchhatitadahaṁ bhaktyupahṛitam aśhnāmi prayatātmanaḥ

25.meaning: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer as oblation to the sacred fire, whatever you bestow as a gift, and whatever austerities you perform, O son of Kunti, do them as an offering to Me.
25.text: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् |यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् || 27||
25.transliteration: yat karoṣhi yad aśhnāsi yaj juhoṣhi dadāsi yatyat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣhva mad-arpaṇam

26.meaning: By dedicating all your works to Me, you will be freed from the bondage of good and bad results.  With your mind attached to Me through renunciation, you will be liberated and will reach Me.

word_meanings.yukta-ātmā: having the mind attached to Me

26.transliteration: śhubhāśhubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣhyase karma-bandhanaiḥsannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣhyasi

27.meaning: I am equally disposed to all living beings; I am neither inimical nor partial to anyone.  But the devotees who worship Me with love reside in Me and I reside in them.
27.text: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रिय: |ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् || 29||
27.transliteration: samo ’haṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu na me dveṣhyo ’sti na priyaḥye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣhu chāpyaham

28.meaning: Even if the vilest sinners worship Me with exclusive devotion, they are to be considered righteous because they have made the proper resolve.
28.text: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् |साधुरेव स मन्तव्य: सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि स: || 30||
28.transliteration: api chet su-durāchāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāksādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ

29.meaning: Quickly they become virtuous, and attain lasting peace.  O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that no devotee of Mine is ever lost.
29.text: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति |कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्त: प्रणश्यति || 31||
29.transliteration: kṣhipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śhaśhvach-chhāntiṁ nigachchhatikaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśhyati

30.meaning: All those who take refuge in Me, whatever their birth, race, gender, or caste, even those whom society scorns, will attain the supreme destination.
30.text: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्यु: पापयोनय: |स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् || 32||
30.transliteration: māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśhritya ye ’pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥstriyo vaiśhyās tathā śhūdrās te ’pi yānti parāṁ gatim

31.meaning: What then to speak about kings and sages with meritorious deeds?  Therefore, having come to this transient and joyless world, engage in devotion unto Me.
31.text: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणा: पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा |अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् || 33||
31.transliteration: kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣhayas tathāanityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām

32.meaning: Always think of Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer obeisance to Me.  Having dedicated your mind and body to Me, you will certainly come to Me.
32.text: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायण: || 34||
32.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskurumām evaiṣhyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ

1.meaning: The Lord said: Listen again to My divine teachings, O mighty armed one. Desiring your welfare because you are My beloved friend, I shall reveal them to you.
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वच: |यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchabhūya eva mahā-bāho śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥyatte ’haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣhyāmi hita-kāmyayā

2.meaning: Neither celestial gods nor the great sages know of My origin. I am the source from which the gods and great seers come.
2.text: न मे विदु: सुरगणा: प्रभवं न महर्षय: |अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वश: || 2||
2.transliteration: na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣhayaḥaham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣhīṇāṁ cha sarvaśhaḥ

3.meaning: Those who know Me as unborn and beginningless, and as the Supreme Lord of the universe, they among mortals are free from illusion and released from all evils.
3.text: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् |असम्मूढ: स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापै: प्रमुच्यते || 3||
3.transliteration: yo māmajam anādiṁ cha vetti loka-maheśhvaramasammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣhu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramuchyate

4.meaning: From Me alone arise the varieties of qualities in humans, such as intellect, knowledge, clarity of thought, forgiveness, truthfulness, control over the senses and mind, joy and sorrow, birth and death, fear and courage, non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy.
4.text: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: |सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च || 4||अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: |भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: || 5||
4.transliteration: buddhir jñānam asammohaḥ kṣhamā satyaṁ damaḥ śhamaḥsukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo ’bhāvo bhayaṁ chābhayameva chaahinsā samatā tuṣhṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśho ’yaśhaḥbhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛithag-vidhāḥ

5.meaning: The seven great Sages, the four great Saints before them, and the fourteen Manus, are all born from My mind. From them, all the people in the world have descended.
5.text: महर्षय: सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा |मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमा: प्रजा: || 6||
5.transliteration: maharṣhayaḥ sapta pūrve chatvāro manavas tathāmad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣhāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ

6.meaning: Those who know in truth My glories and divine powers become united with Me through unwavering Bhakti Yog. Of this there is no doubt.
6.text: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: |सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: || 7||
6.transliteration: etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ cha mama yo vetti tattvataḥso ’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra sanśhayaḥ

7.meaning: I am the origin of all creation. Everything proceeds from Me. The wise who know this perfectly worship Me with great faith and devotion.
7.text: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते |इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: || 8||

word_meanings.bhāva-samanvitāḥ: endowed with great faith and devotion

7.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartateiti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ

8.meaning: With their minds fixed on Me and their lives surrendered to Me, My devotees remain ever content in Me. They derive great satisfaction and bliss in enlightening one another about Me and in conversing about My glories.
8.text: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् |कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च || 9||

word_meanings.mat-chittāḥ: those with minds fixed on me
word_meanings.mat-gata-prāṇāḥ: those who have surrendered their lives to me

8.transliteration: mach-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparamkathayantaśh cha māṁ nityaṁ tuṣhyanti cha ramanti cha

9.meaning: To those whose minds are always united with Me in loving devotion, I give the divine knowledge by which they can attain Me.
9.text: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् |ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते || 10||
9.transliteration: teṣhāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakamdadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te

10.meaning: Out of compassion for them, I, who dwell within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance, with the luminous lamp of knowledge.
10.transliteration: teṣhām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥnāśhayāmyātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā

11.meaning: Arjun said: You are the Supreme Divine Personality, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Purifier, the Eternal God, the Primal Being, the Unborn, and the Greatest. The great sages, like Narad, Asit, Deval, and Vyas, proclaimed this, and now You are declaring it to me Yourself.
11.text: अर्जुन उवाच |परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् || 12||आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे || 13||
11.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaparaṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavānpuruṣhaṁ śhāśhvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhumāhus tvām ṛiṣhayaḥ sarve devarṣhir nāradas tathāasito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ chaiva bravīṣhi me

12.meaning: O Krishna, I totally accept everything You have told me as the Truth. O Lord, neither gods nor the demons can understand Your true personality.
12.text: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव |न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: || 14||

word_meanings.keśhava: Shree Krishna, the killer of the demon named Keshi

12.transliteration: sarvam etad ṛitaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśhavana hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ

13.meaning: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Your inconceivable energy, O Supreme Personality, the Creator and Lord of all beings, the God of gods, and the Lord of the universe!
13.text: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम |भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते || 15||
13.transliteration: swayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣhottamabhūta-bhāvana bhūteśha deva-deva jagat-pate

14.meaning: Please describe to me Your divine opulences, by which You pervade all the worlds and reside in them. O Supreme Master of Yog, how may I know You and think of You. And while meditating, in what forms can I think of You, O Supreme Divine Personality?
14.text: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि || 16||कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया || 17||
14.transliteration: vaktum arhasyaśheṣheṇa divyā hyātma-vibhūtayaḥyābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṁs tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣhṭhasikathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogins tvāṁ sadā parichintayankeṣhu keṣhu cha bhāveṣhu chintyo ’si bhagavan mayā

15.meaning: Tell me again in detail Your divine glories and manifestations, O Janardan. I can never tire of hearing your nectar.
15.text: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |भूय: कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् || 18||

word_meanings.janaārdana: Shree Krishna, he who looks after the public

15.transliteration: vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ cha janārdanabhūyaḥ kathaya tṛiptir hi śhṛiṇvato nāsti me ’mṛitam

16.meaning: The Lord spoke: I shall now briefly describe My divine glories to you, O best of the Kurus, for there is no end to their detail.
16.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||19||
16.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvāchahanta te kathayiṣhyāmi divyā hyātma-vibhūtayaḥprādhānyataḥ kuru-śhreṣhṭha nāstyanto vistarasya me

17.meaning: O Arjun, I am seated in the heart of all living entities. I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.
17.text: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: |अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च || 20||
17.transliteration: aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥaham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha

18.meaning: Amongst the twelve sons of Aditi I am Vishnu; amongst luminous objects I am the sun. Know Me to be Marichi amongst the

word_meanings.ādityānām: amongst the twelve sons of Aditi

18.transliteration: ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir anśhumānmarīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī

19.meaning: I am the Samaveda amongst the Vedas, and Indra amongst the celestial gods. Amongst the senses I am the mind; amongst the living beings I am consciousness.
19.text: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: |इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना || 22||
19.transliteration: vedānāṁ sāma-vedo ’smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥindriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā

20.text: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् |वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् || 23||

word_meanings.vitta-īśhaḥ: the god of wealth and the treasurer of the celestial gods

20.transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasāmvasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruḥ śhikhariṇām aham

21.meaning: O Arjun, amongst priests, I am Brihaspati; amongst warrior chiefs I am Kartikeya; and amongst reservoirs of water, know Me to be the ocean.
21.text: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् |सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: || 24||
21.transliteration: purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛihaspatimsenānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ

22.meaning: I am Bhrigu amongst the great seers and the transcendental Om amongst sounds. Amongst chants know Me to be the repetition of the Holy Name; amongst immovable things I am the Himalayas.
22.text: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् |यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: || 25||

word_meanings.japa-yajñaḥ: sacrifice of the devotional repetition of the divine names of God

22.transliteration: maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛigur ahaṁ girām asmyekam akṣharamyajñānāṁ japa-yajño ’smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ

23.meaning: Amongst trees I am the peepal tree (sacred fig tree); of the celestial sages I am Narad. Amongst the
23.text: अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: |गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: || 26||

word_meanings.siddhānām: of all those who are perfected

23.transliteration: aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛikṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥgandharvāṇāṁ chitrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ

24.meaning: Amongst horses know Me to be Ucchaihshrava, begotten from the churning of the ocean of nectar. I am Airavata amongst all lordly elephants, and the king amongst humans.
24.text: उच्चै:श्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् |ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् || 27||

word_meanings.amṛita-udbhavam: begotten from the churning of the ocean of nectar

24.transliteration: uchchaiḥśhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛitodbhavamairāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam

25.meaning: I am the Vajra (thunderbolt) amongst weapons and Kamadhenu amongst the cows. I am Kaamdev, the god of love, amongst all causes for procreation; and amongst serpents, I am Vasuki.
25.text: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् |प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: || 28||
25.transliteration: āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhukprajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ

26.meaning: Amongst the snakes I am Anant; amongst aquatics I am Varun. Amongst the departed ancestors I am Aryama; amongst dispensers of law I am Yamraj, the lord of death.
26.text: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् |पितृणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् || 29||

word_meanings.varuṇaḥ: the celestial god of the ocean

26.transliteration: anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām ahampitṝīṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ sanyamatām aham

27.meaning: I am Prahlad amongst the demons; amongst all that controls I am time. Know me to be the lion amongst animals, and Garud amongst the birds.
27.text: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् |मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् || 30||
27.transliteration: prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām ahammṛigāṇāṁ cha mṛigendro ’haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām

28.meaning: Amongst purifiers, I am the wind, and amongst wielders of weapons, I am Lord Ram. Of water creatures, I am the crocodile, and of flowing rivers, I am the Ganges.
28.text: पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् |झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी || 31||
28.transliteration: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛitām ahamjhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī

29.meaning: O Arjun, know Me to be the beginning, middle, and end of all creation. Amongst sciences I am the science of spirituality, and in debates I am the logical conclusion.
29.text: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन |अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् || 32||
29.transliteration: sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjunaadhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham

30.meaning: I am the beginning “A” amongst all letters; I am the dual word in grammatical compounds. I am the endless Time, and amongst creators I am Brahma.
30.text: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च |अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: || 33||
30.transliteration: akṣharāṇām a-kāro ’smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya chaaham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśhvato-mukhaḥ

31.meaning: I am the all-devouring death, and I am the origin of those things that are yet to be. Amongst feminine qualities I am fame, prosperity, fine speech, memory, intelligence, courage, and forgiveness.
31.text: मृत्यु: सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् |कीर्ति: श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृति: क्षमा || 34||

word_meanings.bhaviṣhyatām: those things that are yet to be

31.transliteration: mṛityuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatāmkīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛitir medhā dhṛitiḥ kṣhamā

32.meaning: Amongst the hymns in the Samaveda know me to be the Brihatsama; amongst poetic meters I am the Gayatri. Of the twelve months of the Hindu calendar I am Margsheersh, and of seasons I am spring, which brings forth flowers.
32.text: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् |मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकर: || 35||

word_meanings.sāmnām: amongst the hymns in the Sama Veda

32.transliteration: bṛihat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām ahammāsānāṁ mārga-śhīrṣho ’ham ṛitūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ

33.meaning: I am the gambling of the cheats and the splendor of the splendid. I am the victory of the victorious, the resolve of the resolute, and the virtue of the virtuous.
33.text: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् |जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् || 36||
33.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chhalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām ahamjayo ’smi vyavasāyo ’smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham

34.meaning: Amongst the descendants of Vrishni, I am Krishna, and amongst the Pandavas I am Arjun. Know me to be Ved Vyas amongst the sages, and Shukracharya amongst the great thinkers.
34.text: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जय: |मुनीनामप्यहं व्यास: कवीनामुशना कवि: || 37||
34.transliteration: vṛiṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo ’smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥmunīnām apyahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ

35.meaning: I am just punishment amongst means of preventing lawlessness, and proper conduct amongst those who seek victory. Amongst secrets I am silence, and in the wise I am their wisdom.
35.text: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् |मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् || 38||
35.transliteration: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatāmmaunaṁ chaivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham

36.meaning: I am the generating seed of all living beings, O Arjun. No creature moving or non-moving can exist without Me.
36.text: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन |न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् || 39||
36.transliteration: yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjunana tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam

37.meaning: There is no end to My divine manifestations, O conqueror of enemies. What I have declared to you is a mere sample of My infinite glories.
37.text: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप |एष तूद्देशत: प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया || 40||

word_meanings.parantapa: Arjun, the conqueror of the enemies

37.transliteration: nānto ’sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapaeṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā

38.meaning: Whatever you see as beautiful, glorious, or powerful, know it to spring from but a spark of My splendor.
38.text: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा |तत्देवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् || 41||
38.transliteration: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vātat tad evāvagachchha tvaṁ mama tejo ’nśha-sambhavam

39.meaning: What need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjun? Simply know that by one fraction of My being, I pervade and support this entire creation.
39.text: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन |विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् || 42||
39.transliteration: atha vā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjunaviṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛitsnam ekānśhena sthito jagat

1.meaning: Arjun said: Having heard the supremely confidential spiritual knowledge, which You have revealed out of compassion for me, my illusion is now dispelled.
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसञ्ज्ञितम् |यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम || 1||
1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchamad-anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-sanjñitamyat tvayoktaṁ vachas tena moho ’yaṁ vigato mama

2.meaning: I have heard from You in detail about the appearance and disappearance of all living beings, O Lotus-eyed One, and also about Your eternal magnificence.
2.text: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया |त्वत्त: कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् || 2||
2.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śhrutau vistaraśho mayātvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣha māhātmyam api chāvyayam

3.meaning: O Supreme Lord, You are precisely what You declare yourself to be. Now I desire to see Your divine cosmic form, O Greatest of persons.
3.text: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर |द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम || 3||

word_meanings.puruṣha-uttama: Shree Krishna, the Supreme Divine Personality

3.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśhvaradraṣhṭum ichchhāmi te rūpam aiśhwaraṁ puruṣhottama

4.meaning: O Lord of all mystic powers, if You think I am strong enough to behold It, then kindly reveal that imperishable cosmic form to me.
4.text: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो |योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् || 4||
4.transliteration: manyase yadi tach chhakyaṁ mayā draṣhṭum iti prabhoyogeśhvara tato me tvaṁ darśhayātmānam avyayam

5.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O Parth, My hundreds and thousands of wonderful forms of various shapes, sizes, and colors.
5.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रश: |नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च || 5||
5.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchapaśhya me pārtha rūpāṇi śhataśho ’tha sahasraśhaḥnānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛitīni cha

6.meaning: Behold in Me, O scion of the Bharatas, the (twelve) sons of Aditi, the (eight)
6.transliteration: paśhyādityān vasūn rudrān aśhvinau marutas tathābahūny adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvāṇi paśhyāśhcharyāṇi bhārata

7.meaning: Behold now, Arjun, the entire universe, with everything moving and non-moving, assembled together in My universal form. Whatever else you wish to see, observe it all within this universal form.
7.text: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् |मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि || 7||
7.transliteration: ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ paśhyādya sa-charācharammama dehe guḍākeśha yach chānyad draṣhṭum ichchhasi

8.meaning: But you cannot see My cosmic form with these physical eyes of yours. Therefore, I grant you divine vision. Behold My majestic opulence!
8.text: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा |दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षु: पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् || 8||
8.transliteration: na tu māṁ śhakyase draṣhṭum anenaiva sva-chakṣhuṣhādivyaṁ dadāmi te chakṣhuḥ paśhya me yogam aiśhwaram

9.meaning: Sanjay said: O King, having spoken thus, the Supreme Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna, displayed his divine and opulent form to Arjun.
9.text: सञ्जय उवाच |एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरि: |दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् || 9||
9.transliteration: sañjaya uvāchaevam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśhvaro hariḥdarśhayām āsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśhwaram

10.meaning: In that cosmic form, Arjun saw unlimited faces and eyes, decorated with many celestial ornaments and wielding many kinds of divine weapons. He wore many garlands on His body and was anointed with many sweet-smelling heavenly fragrances. He revealed Himself as the wonderful and infinite Lord whose face is everywhere.
10.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśhanamaneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudhamdivya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanamsarvāśhcharya-mayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśhvato-mukham

11.meaning: If a thousand suns were to blaze forth together in the sky, they would not match the splendor of that great form.
11.text: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता |यदि भा: सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मन: || 12||
11.transliteration: divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitāyadi bhāḥ sadṛiśhī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ

12.meaning: There Arjun could see the totality of the entire universe established in one place, in that body of the God of gods.
12.transliteration: tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ pravibhaktam anekadhāapaśhyad deva-devasya śharīre pāṇḍavas tadā

13.meaning: Then, Arjun, full of wonder and with hair standing on end, bowed his head before the Lord and addressed Him, with folded hands.
13.text: तत: स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जय: |प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत || 14||
13.transliteration: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣhṭo hṛiṣhṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥpraṇamya śhirasā devaṁ kṛitāñjalir abhāṣhata

14.meaning: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, I behold within Your body all the gods and hosts of different beings. I see Brahma seated on the lotus flower; I see Shiv, all the sages, and the celestial serpents.
14.text: अर्जुन उवाच |पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहेसर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् |ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ-मृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् || 15||
14.transliteration: arjuna uvāchapaśhyāmi devāns tava deva dehesarvāns tathā bhūta-viśheṣha-saṅghānbrahmāṇam īśhaṁ kamalāsana-sthamṛiṣhīnśh cha sarvān uragānśh cha divyān

15.meaning: I see Your infinite form in every direction, with countless arms, stomachs, faces, and eyes. O Lord of the universe, whose form is the universe itself, I do not see in You any beginning, middle, or end.
15.text: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रंपश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् |नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिंपश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप || 16||
15.transliteration: aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁpaśhyāmi tvāṁ sarvato ’nanta-rūpamnāntaṁ na madhyaṁ na punas tavādiṁpaśhyāmi viśhveśhvara viśhva-rūpa

16.meaning: I see Your form, adorned with a crown, and armed with the club and disc, shining everywhere as the abode of splendor. It is hard to look upon You in the blazing fire of Your effulgence, which is radiating like the sun in all directions.
16.text: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं चतेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् |पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् || 17||
16.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakriṇaṁ chatejo-rāśhiṁ sarvato dīptimantampaśhyāmi tvāṁ durnirīkṣhyaṁ samantāddīptānalārka-dyutim aprameyam

17.meaning: I recognize You as the supreme imperishable being, the Ultimate Truth to be known by the scriptures. You are the support of all creation; You are the eternal protector of
17.text: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यंत्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् |त्वमव्यय: शाश्वतधर्मगोप्तासनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे || 18||
17.transliteration: tvam akṣharaṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁtvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānamtvam avyayaḥ śhāśhvata-dharma-goptāsanātanas tvaṁ puruṣho mato me

18.meaning: You are without beginning, middle, or end; Your power has no limits. Your arms are infinite; the sun and the moon are like Your eyes, and fire is like Your mouth. I see you warming the entire creation by Your radiance.
18.text: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् |पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं-स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् || 19||
18.transliteration: anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryamananta-bāhuṁ śhaśhi-sūrya-netrampaśhyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśha-vaktraṁsva-tejasā viśhvam idaṁ tapantam

19.meaning: The space between heaven and earth and all the directions is pervaded by You alone. Seeing Your wondrous and terrible form, I see the three worlds trembling in fear, O Greatest of all beings.
19.text: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हिव्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वा: |दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदंलोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् || 20||
19.transliteration: dyāv ā-pṛithivyor idam antaraṁ hivyāptaṁ tvayaikena diśhaśh cha sarvāḥdṛiṣhṭvādbhutaṁ rūpam ugraṁ tavedaṁloka-trayaṁ pravyathitaṁ mahātman

20.meaning: All the celestial gods are taking Your shelter by entering into You. In awe, some are praising You with folded hands. The great sages and perfected beings are extolling You with auspicious hymns and profuse prayers.
20.text: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्तिकेचिद्भीता: प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति |स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घा:स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभि: पुष्कलाभि: || 21||
20.transliteration: amī hi tvāṁ sura-saṅghā viśhantikechid bhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛiṇantisvastīty uktvā maharṣhi-siddha-saṅghāḥstuvanti tvāṁ stutibhiḥ puṣhkalābhiḥ

21.text: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च |गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घावीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे || 22||
21.transliteration: rudrādityā vasavo ye cha sādhyāviśhve ’śhvinau marutaśh choṣhmapāśh chagandharva-yakṣhāsura-siddha-saṅghāvīkṣhante tvāṁ vismitāśh chaiva sarve

22.meaning: O mighty Lord, in veneration of Your magnificent form with its many mouths, eyes, arms, thighs, legs, stomachs, and terrifying teeth, all the worlds are terror-stricken, and so am I.
22.text: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रंमहाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् |बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालंदृष्ट्वा लोका: प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् || 23||
22.transliteration: rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁmahā-bāho bahu-bāhūru-pādambahūdaraṁ bahu-danṣhṭrā-karālaṁdṛiṣhṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitās tathāham

23.meaning: O Lord Vishnu, seeing Your form touching the sky, effulgent in many colors, with mouths wide open and enormous blazing eyes, my heart is trembling with fear. I have lost all courage and peace of mind.
23.text: नभ:स्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णंव्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् |दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्माधृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो || 24||

word_meanings.pravyathitāntar-ātmā: my heart is trembling with fear

23.transliteration: nabhaḥ-spṛiśhaṁ dīptam aneka-varṇaṁvyāttānanaṁ dīpta-viśhāla-netramdṛiṣhṭvā hi tvāṁ pravyathitāntar-ātmādhṛitiṁ na vindāmi śhamaṁ cha viṣhṇo

24.meaning: Having seen Your many mouths bearing Your terrible teeth, resembling the raging fire at the time of annihilation, I forget where I am and do not know where to go. O Lord of lords, You are the shelter of the universe; please have mercy on me.
24.text: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानिदृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि |दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्मप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास || 25||
24.transliteration: danṣhṭrā-karālāni cha te mukhānidṛiṣhṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhānidiśho na jāne na labhe cha śharmaprasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa

25.meaning: I see all the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with their allied kings, including Bheeshma, Dronacharya, Karn, and also the generals from our side, rushing headlong into Your fearsome mouths. I see some with their heads smashed between Your terrible teeth.
25.text: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रा:सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घै: |भीष्मो द्रोण: सूतपुत्रस्तथासौसहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यै: || 26||वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्तिदंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि |केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषुसन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गै: || 27||
25.transliteration: amī cha tvāṁ dhṛitarāśhtrasya putrāḥsarve sahaivāvani-pāla-saṅghaiḥbhīṣhmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsausahāsmadīyair api yodha-mukhyaiḥvaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśhantidanṣhṭrā-karālāni bhayānakānikechid vilagnā daśhanāntareṣhusandṛiśhyante chūrṇitair uttamāṅgaiḥ

26.meaning: As many waves of the rivers flowing rapidly into the ocean, so are all these great warriors entering into Your blazing mouths. As moths rush with great speed into the fire to perish, so are all these armies entering with great speed into Your mouths.
26.text: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगा:समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति |तथा तवामी नरलोकवीराविशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति || 28||यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गाविशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगा: |तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका-स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगा: || 29||
26.transliteration: yathā nadīnāṁ bahavo ’mbu-vegāḥsamudram evābhimukhā dravantitathā tavāmī nara-loka-vīrāviśhanti vaktrāṇy abhivijvalantiyathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgāviśhanti nāśhāya samṛiddha-vegāḥtathaiva nāśhāya viśhanti lokāstavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛiddha-vegāḥ

27.meaning: With Your fiery tongues You are licking up the hosts of living beings on all sides and devouring them with Your blazing mouths. O Vishnu, You are scorching the entire universe with the fierce, all-pervading rays of Your effulgence.
27.text: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमान: समन्ता-ल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भि: |तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रंभासस्तवोग्रा: प्रतपन्ति विष्णो || 30||
27.transliteration: lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāllokān samagrān vadanair jvaladbhiḥtejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁbhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣhṇo

28.meaning: Tell me who You are, so fierce of form. O God of gods, I bow before You; please bestow Your mercy on me. You, who existed before all creation, I wish to know who You are, for I do not comprehend Your nature and workings.
28.text: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपोनमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद |विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यंन हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् || 31||
28.transliteration: ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūponamo ’stu te deva-vara prasīdavijñātum ichchhāmi bhavantam ādyaṁna hi prajānāmi tava pravṛittim

29.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: I am mighty Time, the source of destruction that comes forth to annihilate the worlds. Even without your participation, the warriors arrayed in the opposing army shall cease to exist.
29.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धोलोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्त: |ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वेयेऽवस्थिता: प्रत्यनीकेषु योधा: || 32||

word_meanings.loka-kṣhaya-kṛit: the source of destruction of the worlds

29.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchakālo ’smi loka-kṣhaya-kṛit pravṛiddholokān samāhartum iha pravṛittaḥṛite ’pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣhyanti sarveye ’vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣhu yodhāḥ

30.meaning: Therefore, arise and attain honor! Conquer your foes and enjoy prosperous rulership. These warriors stand already slain by Me, and you will only be an instrument of My work, O expert archer.
30.text: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्वजित्वा शत्रून्भुङ् क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् |मयैवैते निहता: पूर्वमेवनिमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् || 33||

word_meanings.savya-sāchin: Arjun, the one who can shoot arrows with both hands

30.transliteration: tasmāt tvam uttiṣhṭha yaśho labhasvajitvā śhatrūn bhuṅkṣhva rājyaṁ samṛiddhammayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam evanimitta-mātraṁ bhava savya-sāchin

31.meaning: Dronacharya, Bheeshma, Jayadratha, Karn, and other brave warriors have already been killed by Me. Therefore, slay them without being disturbed. Just fight and you will be victorious over your enemies in battle.
31.text: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं चकर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् |मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठायुध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् || 34||
31.transliteration: droṇaṁ cha bhīṣhmaṁ cha jayadrathaṁ chakarṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrānmayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣhṭhāyudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān

32.meaning: Sanjay said: Hearing these words of Keshav, Arjun trembled with dread. With palms joined, he bowed before Shree Krishna and spoke in a faltering voice, overwhelmed with fear.
32.text: सञ्जय उवाच |एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्यकृताञ्जलिर्वेपमान: किरीटी |नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णंसगद्गदं भीतभीत: प्रणम्य || 35||
32.transliteration: sañjaya uvāchaetach chhrutvā vachanaṁ keśhavasyakṛitāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭīnamaskṛitvā bhūya evāha kṛiṣhṇaṁsa-gadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya

33.meaning: Arjun said: O Master of the senses, it is but apt that the universe rejoices in giving You praise and is enamored by You. Demons flee fearfully from You in all directions and hosts of perfected saints bow to You.
33.text: अर्जुन उवाच |स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्याजगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च |रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्तिसर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घा: || 36||

word_meanings.hṛiṣhīka-īśha: Shree Krishna, the master of the senses

33.transliteration: arjuna uvāchasthāne hṛiṣhīkeśha tava prakīrtyājagat prahṛiṣhyaty anurajyate charakṣhānsi bhītāni diśho dravantisarve namasyanti cha siddha-saṅghāḥ

34.meaning: O Great One, who are even greater than Brahma, the original creator, why should they not bow to you? O Limitless One, O Lord of the
34.text: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे |अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवासत्वमक्षरं सदसतत्परं यत् || 37||
34.transliteration: kasmāch cha te na nameran mahātmangarīyase brahmaṇo ’py ādi-kartreananta deveśha jagan-nivāsatvam akṣharaṁ sad-asat tat paraṁ yat

35.meaning: You are the primeval God and the original Divine Personality; You are the sole resting place of this universe. You are both the knower and the object of knowledge; You are the Supreme Abode. O possessor of infinite forms, You alone pervade the entire universe.
35.text: त्वमादिदेव: पुरुष: पुराणस्-	त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् |वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम	त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप || 38||
35.transliteration: tvam ādi-devaḥ puruṣhaḥ purāṇastvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānamvettāsi vedyaṁ cha paraṁ cha dhāmatvayā tataṁ viśhvam ananta-rūpa

36.text: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुण: शशाङ्क:प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च |नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्व:पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते || 39||
36.transliteration: vāyur yamo ’gnir varuṇaḥ śhaśhāṅkaḥprajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaśh chanamo namas te ’stu sahasra-kṛitvaḥpunaśh cha bhūyo ’pi namo namas te

37.meaning: O Lord of infinite power, my salutations to You from the front and the rear, indeed from all sides! You possess infinite valor and might and pervade everything, and thus, You are everything.
37.text: नम: पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्तेनमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व |अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वंसर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्व: || 40||
37.transliteration: namaḥ purastād atha pṛiṣhṭhatas tenamo ’stu te sarvata eva sarvaananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁsarvaṁ samāpnoṣhi tato ’si sarvaḥ

38.meaning: Thinking of You as my friend, I presumptuously addressed You as, “O Krishna,” “O Yadav,” “O my dear Friend.” I was ignorant of Your majesty, showing negligence and undue affection. And if, jestfully, I treated You with disrespect, while playing, resting, sitting, eating, when alone, or before others—for all that I crave forgiveness.
38.text: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति |अजानता महिमानं तवेदंमया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि || 41||यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसिविहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु |एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षंतत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् || 42||

word_meanings.he yādava: O Shree Krishna, who was born in the Yadu clan

38.transliteration: sakheti matvā prasabhaṁ yad uktaṁhe kṛiṣhṇa he yādava he sakhetiajānatā mahimānaṁ tavedaṁmayā pramādāt praṇayena vāpiyach chāvahāsārtham asat-kṛito ’sivihāra-śhayyāsana-bhojaneṣhueko ’tha vāpy achyuta tat-samakṣhaṁtat kṣhāmaye tvām aham aprameyam

39.meaning: You are the Father of the entire universe, of all moving and non-moving beings. You are the most deserving of worship and the Supreme Spiritual Master. When there is none equal to You in all the three worlds, then who can possibly be greater than You, O Possessor of incomparable power?
39.text: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्यत्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् |न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिक: कुतोऽन्योलोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव || 43||
39.transliteration: pitāsi lokasya charācharasyatvam asya pūjyaśh cha gurur garīyānna tvat-samo ’sty abhyadhikaḥ kuto ’nyoloka-traye ’py apratima-prabhāva

40.meaning: Therefore, O adorable Lord, bowing deeply and prostrating before You, I implore You for Your grace. As a father tolerates his son, a friend forgives his friend, and a lover pardons the beloved, please forgive me for my offences.
40.text: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायंप्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् |पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्यु:प्रिय: प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् || 44||
40.transliteration: tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁprasādaye tvām aham īśham īḍyampiteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥpriyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum

41.meaning: Having seen Your universal form that I had never seen before, I feel great joy. And yet, my mind trembles with fear. Please have mercy on me and again show me Your pleasing form, O God of gods, O Abode of the universe.
41.text: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वाभयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे |तदेव मे दर्शय देवरूपंप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास || 45||

word_meanings.adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvam: that which has not been seen before

41.transliteration: adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvaṁ hṛiṣhito ’smi dṛiṣhṭvābhayena cha pravyathitaṁ mano metad eva me darśhaya deva rūpaṁprasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa

42.meaning: O Thousand-armed One, though You are the embodiment of all creation, I wish to see You in Your four-armed form, carrying the mace and disc, and wearing the crown.
42.text: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त-मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव |तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेनसहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते || 46||
42.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakra-hastamichchhāmi tvāṁ draṣhṭum ahaṁ tathaivatenaiva rūpeṇa chatur-bhujenasahasra-bāho bhava viśhva-mūrte

43.meaning: The Lord said: Arjun, being pleased with you, by My
43.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदंरूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् |तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यंयन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् || 47||
43.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchamayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁrūpaṁ paraṁ darśhitam ātma-yogāttejo-mayaṁ viśhvam anantam ādyaṁyan me tvad anyena na dṛiṣhṭa-pūrvam

44.meaning: Not by study of the Vedas, nor by the performance of sacrifice, rituals, or charity, nor even by practicing severe austerities, has any mortal ever seen what you have seen, O best of the Kuru warriors.
44.text: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै-र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रै: |एवंरूप: शक्य अहं नृलोकेद्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर || 48||

word_meanings.nṛi-loke: in the world of the mortals
word_meanings.kuru-pravīra: the best of the Kuru warriors

44.transliteration: na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānairna cha kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥevaṁ-rūpaḥ śhakya ahaṁ nṛi-lokedraṣhṭuṁ tvad anyena kuru-pravīra

45.meaning: Be neither afraid nor bewildered on seeing this terrible form of Mine. Be free from fear and with a cheerful heart, behold Me once again in My personal form.
45.text: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावोदृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् |व्यपेतभी: प्रीतमना: पुनस्त्वंतदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य || 49||
45.transliteration: mā te vyathā mā cha vimūḍha-bhāvodṛiṣhṭvā rūpaṁ ghoram īdṛiṅ mamedamvyapeta-bhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṁtad eva me rūpam idaṁ prapaśhya

46.meaning: Sanjay said: Having spoken thus, the compassionate son of Vasudev displayed His personal (four-armed) form again. Then, He further consoled the frightened Arjun by assuming His gentle (two-armed) form.
46.text: सञ्जय उवाच |इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वास्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूय: |आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनंभूत्वा पुन: सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा || 50||
46.transliteration: sañjaya uvāchaity arjunaṁ vāsudevas tathoktvāsvakaṁ rūpaṁ darśhayām āsa bhūyaḥāśhvāsayām āsa cha bhītam enaṁbhūtvā punaḥ saumya-vapur mahātmā

47.meaning: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, seeing Your gentle human form (two-armed), I have regained my composure and my mind is restored to normal.
47.text: अर्जुन उवाच |दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन |इदानीमस्मि संवृत्त: सचेता: प्रकृतिं गत: || 51||

word_meanings.janārdana: he who looks after the public, Krishna

47.transliteration: arjuna uvāchadṛiṣhṭvedaṁ mānuṣhaṁ rūpaṁ tava saumyaṁ janārdanaidānīm asmi saṁvṛittaḥ sa-chetāḥ prakṛitiṁ gataḥ

48.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: This form of Mine that you are seeing is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the celestial gods are eager to see it. Neither by the study of the Vedas, nor by penance, charity, or fire sacrifices, can I be seen as you have seen Me.
48.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम |देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: || 52||नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया |शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा || 53||
48.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchasu-durdarśham idaṁ rūpaṁ dṛiṣhṭavān asi yan mamadevā apy asya rūpasya nityaṁ darśhana-kāṅkṣhiṇaḥnāhaṁ vedair na tapasā na dānena na chejyayāśhakya evaṁ-vidho draṣhṭuṁ dṛiṣhṭavān asi māṁ yathā

49.meaning: O Arjun, by unalloyed devotion alone can I be known as I am, standing before you. Thereby, on receiving My divine vision, O scorcher of foes, one can enter into union with Me.
49.text: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन |ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप || 54||
49.transliteration: bhaktyā tv ananyayā śhakya aham evaṁ-vidho ’rjunajñātuṁ draṣhṭuṁ cha tattvena praveṣhṭuṁ cha parantapa

50.meaning: Those who perform all their duties for My sake, who depend upon Me and are devoted to Me, who are free from attachment, and are without malice toward all beings, such devotees certainly come to Me.
50.text: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्त: सङ्गवर्जित: |निर्वैर: सर्वभूतेषु य: स मामेति पाण्डव || 55||
50.transliteration: mat-karma-kṛin mat-paramo mad-bhaktaḥ saṅga-varjitaḥnirvairaḥ sarva-bhūteṣhu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava

1.meaning: Arjun inquired: Between those who are steadfastly devoted to Your personal form and those who worship the formless Brahman, whom do You consider to be more perfect in Yog?
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते |ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमा: || 1||
1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaevaṁ satata-yuktā ye bhaktās tvāṁ paryupāsateye chāpy akṣharam avyaktaṁ teṣhāṁ ke yoga-vittamāḥ

2.meaning: The Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and always engage in My devotion with steadfast faith, I consider them to be the best yogis.
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते |श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मता: || 2||
2.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchamayy āveśhya mano ye māṁ nitya-yuktā upāsateśhraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ

3.meaning: But those who worship the formless aspect of the Absolute Truth—the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the all-pervading, the unthinkable, the unchanging, the eternal, and the immoveable—by restraining their senses and being even-minded everywhere, such persons, engaged in the welfare of all beings, also attain Me.
3.text: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते |सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यञ्च कूटस्थमचलन्ध्रुवम् || 3||सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धय: |ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रता: || 4||

word_meanings.sarva-bhūta-hite: in the welfare of all beings

3.transliteration: ye tv akṣharam anirdeśhyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsatesarvatra-gam achintyañcha kūṭa-stham achalandhruvamsanniyamyendriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥte prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ

4.meaning: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the path of realization is full of tribulations.  Worship of the unmanifest is exceedingly difficult for embodied beings.
4.transliteration: kleśho ’dhikataras teṣhām avyaktāsakta-chetasāmavyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate

5.meaning: But those who dedicate all their actions to Me, regarding Me as the Supreme goal, worshiping Me and meditating on Me with exclusive devotion, O Parth, I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death, for their consciousness is united with Me.
5.text: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्न्यस्य मत्पर: |अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते || 6||तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् |भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् || 7||

word_meanings.mat-paraḥ: regarding Me as the Supreme goal
word_meanings.mṛityu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt: from the ocean of birth and death
word_meanings.āveśhita chetasām: of those whose consciousness is united

5.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsateteṣhām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛityu-saṁsāra-sāgarātbhavāmi na chirāt pārtha mayy āveśhita-chetasām

6.meaning: Fix your mind on Me alone and surrender your intellect to Me.  There upon, you will always live in Me.  Of this, there is no doubt.
6.text: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय |निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशय: || 8||
6.transliteration: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśhayanivasiṣhyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na sanśhayaḥ

7.meaning: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily on Me, O Arjun, then practice remembering Me with devotion while constantly restraining the mind from worldly affairs.
7.text: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् |अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय || 9||

word_meanings.abhyāsa-yogena: by uniting with God through repeated practice

7.transliteration: atha chittaṁ samādhātuṁ na śhaknoṣhi mayi sthiramabhyāsa-yogena tato mām ichchhāptuṁ dhanañjaya

8.meaning: If you cannot practice remembering Me with devotion, then just try to work for Me.  Thus performing devotional service to Me, you shall achieve the stage of perfection.
8.transliteration: abhyāse ’py asamartho ’si mat-karma-paramo bhavamad-artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi

9.meaning: If you are unable to even work for Me in devotion, then try to renounce the fruits of your actions and be situated in the self.
9.text: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रित: |सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं तत: कुरु यतात्मवान् || 11||
9.transliteration: athaitad apy aśhakto ’si kartuṁ mad-yogam āśhritaḥsarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān

10.meaning: Better than mechanical practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation.  Better than meditation is renunciation of the fruits of actions, for peace immediately follows such renunciation.

word_meanings.karma-phala-tyāgaḥ: renunciation of the fruits of actions

10.transliteration: śhreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṁ viśhiṣhyatedhyānāt karma-phala-tyāgas tyāgāch chhāntir anantaram

11.meaning: Those devotees are very dear to Me who are free from malice toward all living beings, who are friendly, and compassionate.  They are free from attachment to possessions and egotism, equipoised in happiness and distress, and ever-forgiving.   They are ever-content, steadily united with Me in devotion, self-controlled, of firm resolve, and dedicated to Me in mind and intellect.
11.text: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्र: करुण एव च |निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: समदु:खसुख: क्षमी || 13||सन्तुष्ट: सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चय: |मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्त: स मे प्रिय: || 14||
11.transliteration: adveṣhṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva chanirmamo nirahankāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣhamīsantuṣhṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛiḍha-niśhchayaḥmayy arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ

12.meaning: Those who are not a source of annoyance to anyone and who in turn are not agitated by anyone, who are equal in pleasure and pain, and free from fear and anxiety, such devotees of Mine are very dear to Me.
12.text: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च य: |हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो य: स च मे प्रिय: || 15||
12.transliteration: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate cha yaḥharṣhāmarṣha-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa cha me priyaḥ

13.meaning: Those who are indifferent to worldly gains, externally and internally pure, skillful, without cares, untroubled, and free from selfishness in all undertakings, such devotees of Mine are very dear to Me.
13.text: अनपेक्ष: शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथ: |सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्त: स मे प्रिय: || 16||
13.transliteration: anapekṣhaḥ śhuchir dakṣha udāsīno gata-vyathaḥsarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ

14.meaning: Those who neither rejoice in mundane pleasures nor despair in worldly sorrows, who neither lament for any loss nor hanker for any gain, who renounce both good and evil deeds, such persons who are full of devotion are very dear to Me.
14.text: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ् क्षति |शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्य: स मे प्रिय: || 17||

word_meanings.śhubha-aśhubha-parityāgī: who renounce both good and evil deeds

14.transliteration: yo na hṛiṣhyati na dveṣhṭi na śhochati na kāṅkṣhatiśhubhāśhubha-parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ

15.meaning: Those, who are alike to friend and foe, equipoised in honor and dishonor, cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and are free from all unfavorable association; those who take praise and reproach alike, who are given to silent contemplation, content with what comes their way, without attachment to the place of residence, whose intellect is firmly fixed in Me, and who are full of devotion to Me, such persons are very dear to Me.
15.text: सम: शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयो: |शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु सम: सङ्गविवर्जित: || 18||तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् |अनिकेत: स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नर: || 19||

word_meanings.aniketaḥ: without attachment to the place of residence

15.transliteration: samaḥ śhatrau cha mitre cha tathā mānāpamānayoḥśhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥtulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣhṭo yena kenachitaniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ

16.meaning: Those who honor this nectar of wisdom declared here, have faith in Me, and are devoted and intent on Me as the supreme goal, they are exceedingly dear to Me.
16.text: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते |श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रिया: || 20||

word_meanings.mat-paramāḥ: intent on Me as the supreme goal
