16.transliteration: ye tu dharmyāmṛitam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsateśhraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te ’tīva me priyāḥ

1.meaning: Arjun said, “O Keshav, I wish to understand what are
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च |एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव || 1||* 1

word_meanings.keśhava: Krishna, the killer of the demon named Keshi

1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaprakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva kṣhetraṁ kṣhetra-jñam eva chaetad veditum ichchhāmi jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ cha keśhava

2.meaning: The Supreme Divine Lord said: O Arjun, this body is termed as
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते |एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहु: क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विद: || 2||
2.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchaidaṁ śharīraṁ kaunteya kṣhetram ity abhidhīyateetad yo vetti taṁ prāhuḥ kṣhetra-jña iti tad-vidaḥ

3.meaning: O scion of Bharat, I am also the knower of all the individual fields of activity.  The understanding of the body as the field of activities, and the soul and God as the knowers of the field, this I hold to be true knowledge.
3.text: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत |क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम || 3||

word_meanings.kṣhetra-jñayoḥ: of the knower of the field

3.transliteration: kṣhetra-jñaṁ chāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣhetreṣhu bhāratakṣhetra-kṣhetrajñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama

4.meaning: Listen and I will explain to you what that field is and what its nature is.  I will also explain how change takes place within it, from what it was created, who the knower of the field of activities is, and what his powers are.
4.text: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् |स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु || 4||

word_meanings.yat-vikāri: how change takes place in it

4.transliteration: tat kṣhetraṁ yach cha yādṛik cha yad-vikāri yataśh cha yatsa cha yo yat-prabhāvaśh cha tat samāsena me śhṛiṇu

5.meaning: Great sages have sung the truth about the field and the knower of the field in manifold ways.  It has been stated in various Vedic hymns, and especially revealed in the Brahma Sūtra, with sound logic and conclusive evidence.
5.transliteration: ṛiṣhibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chhandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛithakbrahma-sūtra-padaiśh chaiva hetumadbhir viniśhchitaiḥ

6.meaning: The field of activities is composed of the five great elements, the ego, the intellect, the unmanifest primordial matter, the eleven senses (five knowledge senses, five working senses, and mind), and the five objects of the senses.
6.text: महाभूतान्यङ्ककारो बुद्धिरव्यक्त मेव च |इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचरा: || 6||
6.transliteration: mahā-bhūtāny ahankāro buddhir avyaktam eva chaindriyāṇi daśhaikaṁ cha pañcha chendriya-gocharāḥ

7.meaning: Desire and aversion, happiness and misery, the body, consciousness, and the will—all these comprise the field and its modifications.
7.text: इच्छा द्वेष: सुखं दु:खं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृति: |एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् || 7||
7.transliteration: ichchhā dveṣhaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaśh chetanā dhṛitiḥetat kṣhetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛitam

8.meaning: Humbleness; freedom from hypocrisy; non-violence; forgiveness; simplicity; service of the Guru; cleanliness of body and mind; steadfastness; and self-control; dispassion toward the objects of the senses; absence of egotism; keeping in mind the evils of birth, disease, old age, and death; non-attachment; absence of clinging to spouse, children, home, and so on; even-mindedness amidst desired and undesired events in life; constant and exclusive devotion toward Me; an inclination for solitary places and an aversion for mundane society; constancy in spiritual knowledge; and philosophical pursuit of the Absolute Truth—all these I declare to be knowledge, and what is contrary to it, I call ignorance.
8.text: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् |आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रह: || 8||इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च |जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदु:खदोषानुदर्शनम् || 9||असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्ग: पुत्रदारगृहादिषु |नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु || 10||मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी |विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि || 11||अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् |एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा || 12||
8.transliteration: amānitvam adambhitvam ahinsā kṣhāntir ārjavamāchāryopāsanaṁ śhauchaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥindriyārtheṣhu vairāgyam anahankāra eva chajanma-mṛityu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣhānudarśhanamasaktir anabhiṣhvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛihādiṣhunityaṁ cha sama-chittatvam iṣhṭāniṣhṭopapattiṣhumayi chānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhichāriṇīvivikta-deśha-sevitvam aratir jana-sansadiadhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṁ tattva-jñānārtha-darśhanametaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṁ yad ato ’nyathā

9.meaning: I shall now reveal to you that which ought to be known, and by knowing which, one attains immortality.  It is the beginningless Brahman, which lies beyond existence and non-existence.
9.text: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्रुते |अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते || 13||
9.transliteration: jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣhyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛitam aśhnuteanādi mat-paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad uchyate

10.meaning: Everywhere are His hands and feet, eyes, heads, and faces.  His ears too are in all places, for He pervades everything in the universe.
10.text: सर्वत: पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् |सर्वत: श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति || 14||
10.transliteration: sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato ’kṣhi-śhiro-mukhamsarvataḥ śhrutimal loke sarvam āvṛitya tiṣhṭhati

11.meaning: Though He perceives all sense-objects, yet He is devoid of the senses.  He is unattached to everything, and yet He is the sustainer of all.  Although He is without attributes, yet He is the enjoyer of the three modes of material nature.
11.text: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् |असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च || 15||

word_meanings.nirguṇam: beyond the three modes of material nature
word_meanings.guṇa-bhoktṛi: the enjoyer of the three modes of material nature

11.transliteration: sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitamasaktaṁ sarva-bhṛich chaiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛi cha

12.meaning: He exists outside and inside all living beings, those that are moving and not moving.  He is subtle, and hence, He is incomprehensible.  He is very far, but He is also very near.
12.text: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च |सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् || 16||
12.transliteration: bahir antaśh cha bhūtānām acharaṁ charam eva chasūkṣhmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūra-sthaṁ chāntike cha tat

13.meaning: He is indivisible, yet He appears to be divided amongst living beings.  Know the Supreme Entity to be the Sustainer, Annihilator, and Creator of all beings.
13.text: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् |भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च || 17||
13.transliteration: avibhaktaṁ cha bhūteṣhu vibhaktam iva cha sthitambhūta-bhartṛi cha taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣhṇu prabhaviṣhṇu cha

14.meaning: He is the source of light in all luminaries, and is entirely beyond the darkness of ignorance.  He is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge.  He dwells within the hearts of all living beings.
14.text: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमस: परमुच्यते |ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् || 18||
14.transliteration: jyotiṣhām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param uchyatejñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛidi sarvasya viṣhṭhitam

15.meaning: I have thus revealed to you the nature of the field, the meaning of knowledge, and the object of knowledge.  Only My devotees can understand this in reality, and by doing so, they attain My divine nature.
15.text: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासत: |मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते || 19||
15.transliteration: iti kṣhetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ choktaṁ samāsataḥmad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate

16.text: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि |विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् || 20||
16.transliteration: prakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva viddhy anādī ubhāv apivikārānśh cha guṇānśh chaiva viddhi prakṛiti-sambhavān

17.meaning: In the matter of creation, the material energy is responsible for cause and effect; in the matter of experiencing happiness and distress, the individual soul is declared responsible.
17.text: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते |पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते || 21||
17.transliteration: kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛitve hetuḥ prakṛitir uchyatepuruṣhaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛitve hetur uchyate

18.text: पुरुष: प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङक्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् |कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु || 22||
18.transliteration: puruṣhaḥ prakṛiti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛiti-jān guṇānkāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo ’sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu

19.meaning: Within the body also resides the Supreme Lord.  He is said to be the Witness, the Permitter, the Supporter, Transcendental Enjoyer, the ultimate Controller, and the
19.text: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वर: |परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुष: पर: || 23||
19.transliteration: upadraṣhṭānumantā cha bhartā bhoktā maheśhvaraḥparamātmeti chāpy ukto dehe ’smin puruṣhaḥ paraḥ

20.meaning: Those who understand the truth about Supreme Soul, the individual soul, material nature, and the interaction of the three modes of nature will not take birth here again.  They will be liberated regardless of their present condition.
20.text: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणै: सह |सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते || 24||
20.transliteration: ya evaṁ vetti puruṣhaṁ prakṛitiṁ cha guṇaiḥ sahasarvathā vartamāno ’pi na sa bhūyo ’bhijāyate

21.meaning: Some try to perceive the Supreme Soul within their hearts through meditation, and others try to do so through the cultivation of knowledge, while still others strive to attain that realization by the path of action.
21.text: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना |अन्ये साङ् ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे || 25||

word_meanings.karma-yogena: union with God with through path of action

21.transliteration: dhyānenātmani paśhyanti kechid ātmānam ātmanāanye sānkhyena yogena karma-yogena chāpare

22.meaning: There are still others who are unaware of these spiritual paths, but they hear from others and begin worshipping the Supreme Lord.  By such devotion to hearing from saints, they too can gradually cross over the ocean of birth and death.
22.text: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्त: श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते |तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणा: || 26||

word_meanings.ajānantaḥ: those who are unaware (of spiritual paths)

22.transliteration: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śhrutvānyebhya upāsatete ’pi chātitaranty eva mṛityuṁ śhruti-parāyaṇāḥ

23.meaning: O best of the Bharatas, whatever moving or unmoving being you see in existence, know it to be a combination of the field of activities and the knower of the field.
23.transliteration: yāvat sañjāyate kiñchit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamamkṣhetra-kṣhetrajña-sanyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣhabha

24.meaning: They alone truly see, who perceive the
24.text: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् |विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं य: पश्यति स पश्यति || 28||
24.transliteration: samaṁ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu tiṣhṭhantaṁ parameśhvaramvinaśhyatsv avinaśhyantaṁ yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati

25.meaning: Those, who see God as the Supreme Soul equally present everywhere and in all living beings, do not degrade themselves by their mind.  Thereby, they reach the supreme destination.
25.text: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् |न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् || 29||
25.transliteration: samaṁ paśhyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśhvaramna hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim

26.meaning: They alone truly see who understand that all actions (of the body) are performed by material nature, while the embodied soul actually does nothing.
26.text: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वश: |य: पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति || 30||
26.transliteration: prakṛityaiva cha karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśhaḥyaḥ paśhyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśhyati

27.meaning: When they see the diverse variety of living beings situated in the same material nature, and understand all of them to be born from it, they attain the realization of the Brahman.
27.text: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति |तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा || 31||
27.transliteration: yadā bhūta-pṛithag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśhyatitata eva cha vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā

28.meaning: The Supreme Soul is imperishable, without beginning, and devoid of any material qualities, O son of Kunti.  Although situated within the body, It neither acts, nor is It tainted by material energy.
28.text: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्यय: |शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते || 32||

word_meanings.nirguṇatvāt: being devoid of any material qualities
word_meanings.kaunteya: Arjun, the the son of Kunti

28.transliteration: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥśharīra-stho ’pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate

29.meaning: Space holds everything within it, but being subtle, does not get contaminated by what it holds.  Similarly, though its consciousness pervades the body, the soul is not affected by the attributes of the body.
29.text: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते |सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते || 33||
29.transliteration: yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣhmyād ākāśhaṁ nopalipyatesarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate

30.meaning: Just as one sun illumines the entire solar system, so does the individual soul illumine the entire body (with consciousness).
30.text: यथा प्रकाशयत्येक: कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रवि: |क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत || 34||
30.transliteration: yathā prakāśhayaty ekaḥ kṛitsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥkṣhetraṁ kṣhetrī tathā kṛitsnaṁ prakāśhayati bhārata

31.meaning: Those who perceive with the eyes of knowledge the difference between the body and the knower of the body, and the process of release from material nature, attain the supreme destination.
31.text: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा |भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् || 35||

word_meanings.kṣhetra-jñayoḥ: of the knower of the body

31.transliteration: kṣhetra-kṣhetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-chakṣhuṣhābhūta-prakṛiti-mokṣhaṁ cha ye vidur yānti te param

1.meaning: The Divine Lord said: I shall once again explain to you the supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge; by knowing which, all the great saints attained the highest perfection.
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |परं भूय: प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् |यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनय: सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गता: || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchaparaṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣhyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamamyaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ

2.meaning: Those who take refuge in this wisdom will be united with Me. They will not be reborn at the time of creation nor destroyed at the time of dissolution.
2.text: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागता: |सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च || 2||
2.transliteration: idaṁ jñānam upāśhritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥsarge ’pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti cha

3.text: मम योनिर्महद् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् |सम्भव: सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत || 3||सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तय: सम्भवन्ति या: |तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रद: पिता || 4||
3.transliteration: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy ahamsambhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhāratasarva-yoniṣhu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥtāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā

4.meaning: O mighty-armed Arjun, the material energy consists of three
4.text: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणा: प्रकृतिसम्भवा: |निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् || 5||
4.transliteration: sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛiti-sambhavāḥnibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam

5.text: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् |सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ || 6||
5.transliteration: tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśhakam anāmayamsukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena chānagha

6.text: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् | तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् || 7||
6.transliteration: rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛiṣhṇā-saṅga-samudbhavamtan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam

7.transliteration: tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehināmpramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata

8.text: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रज: कर्मणि भारत |ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तम: प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत || 9||
8.transliteration: sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhāratajñānam āvṛitya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta

9.text: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत |रज: सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तम: सत्त्वं रजस्तथा || 10||
9.transliteration: rajas tamaśh chābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhāratarajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaśh chaiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā

10.meaning: When all the gates of the body are illumined by knowledge, know it to be a manifestation of the mode of goodness. When the mode of passion predominates, O Arjun, the symptoms of greed, exertion for worldly gain, restlessness, and craving develop. O Arjun, nescience, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these are the dominant signs of the mode of ignorance.
10.text: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते |ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत || 11||लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा |रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ || 12||अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च |तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन || 13||

word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: the best of the Bharatas, Arjun
word_meanings.kuru-nandana: the joy of the Kurus, Arjun

10.transliteration: sarva-dvāreṣhu dehe ’smin prakāśha upajāyatejñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛiddhaṁ sattvam ity utalobhaḥ pravṛittir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśhamaḥ spṛihārajasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe bharatarṣhabhaaprakāśho ’pravṛittiśh cha pramādo moha eva chatamasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe kuru-nandana

11.meaning: Those who die with predominance of
11.text: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् |तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते || 14||रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते |तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते || 15||
11.transliteration: yadā sattve pravṛiddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛittadottama-vidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyaterajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣhu jāyatetathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣhu jāyate

12.meaning: It is said the fruit of actions performed in the mode of goodness bestow pure results. Actions done in the mode of passion result in pain, while those performed in the mode of ignorance result in darkness.
12.text: कर्मण: सुकृतस्याहु: सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् |रजसस्तु फलं दु:खमज्ञानं तमस: फलम् || 16||
12.transliteration: karmaṇaḥ sukṛitasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalamrajasas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam

13.meaning: From the mode of goodness arises knowledge, from the mode of passion arises greed, and from the mode of ignorance arise negligence and delusion.
13.text: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च |प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च || 17||
13.transliteration: sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva chapramāda-mohau tamaso bhavato ’jñānam eva cha

14.meaning: Those situated in the mode of goodness rise upward; those in the mode of passion stay in the middle; and those in the mode of ignorance go downward.
14.text: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसा: |जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसा: || 18||

word_meanings.sattva-sthāḥ: those situated in the mode of goodness
word_meanings.rājasāḥ: those in the mode of passion
word_meanings.tāmasāḥ: those in the mode of ignorance

14.transliteration: ūrdhvaṁ gachchhanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣhṭhanti rājasāḥjaghanya-guṇa-vṛitti-sthā adho gachchhanti tāmasāḥ

15.meaning: When wise persons see that in all work there is no agent of action other than the three
15.text: नान्यं गुणेभ्य: कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति |गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति || 19||
15.transliteration: nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣhṭānupaśhyatiguṇebhyaśh cha paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so ’dhigachchhati

16.meaning: By transcending the three modes of material nature associated with the body, one becomes free from birth, death, old age, and misery, and attains immortality.

word_meanings.guṇān: the three modes of material nature

16.transliteration: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavānjanma-mṛityu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto ’mṛitam aśhnute

17.meaning: Arjun inquired: What are the characteristics of those who have gone beyond the three
17.text: अर्जुन उवाच |कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो |किमाचार: कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते || 21||
17.transliteration: arjuna uvāchakair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabhokim āchāraḥ kathaṁ chaitāns trīn guṇān ativartate

18.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O Arjun, The persons who are transcendental to the three
18.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव |न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ् क्षति || 22||उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते |गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते || 23||

word_meanings.guṇaiḥ: to the modes of material nature

18.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchaprakāśhaṁ cha pravṛittiṁ cha moham eva cha pāṇḍavana dveṣhṭi sampravṛittāni na nivṛittāni kāṅkṣhatiudāsīna-vad āsīno guṇair yo na vichālyateguṇā vartanta ity evaṁ yo ’vatiṣhṭhati neṅgate

19.meaning: Those who are alike in happiness and distress; who are established in the self; who look upon a clod, a stone, and a piece of gold as of equal value; who remain the same amidst pleasant and unpleasant events; who are intelligent; who accept both blame and praise with equanimity; who remain the same in honor and dishonor; who treat both friend and foe alike; and who have abandoned all enterprises – they are said to have risen above the three
19.text: समदु:खसुख: स्वस्थ: समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: |तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुति: || 24||मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयो: |सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीत: स उच्यते || 25||

word_meanings.guṇa-atītaḥ: risen above the three modes of material nature

19.transliteration: sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ sva-sthaḥ sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥtulya-priyāpriyo dhīras tulya-nindātma-sanstutiḥmānāpamānayos tulyas tulyo mitrāri-pakṣhayoḥsarvārambha-parityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa uchyate

20.meaning: Those who serve Me with unalloyed devotion rise above the three modes of material nature and come to the level of the Brahman.
20.text: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते |स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते || 26||

word_meanings.guṇān: the three modes of material nature

20.transliteration: māṁ cha yo ’vyabhichāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevatesa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate

21.meaning: I am the basis of the formless Brahman, the immortal and imperishable, of eternal dharma, and of unending divine bliss.
21.text: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च |शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च || 27||
21.transliteration: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣhṭhāham amṛitasyāvyayasya chaśhāśhvatasya cha dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya cha

1.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality said: They speak of an eternal
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |ऊर्ध्वमूलमध:शाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् |छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् || 1||
1.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchaūrdhva-mūlam adhaḥ-śhākham aśhvatthaṁ prāhur avyayamchhandānsi yasya parṇāni yas taṁ veda sa veda-vit

2.meaning: The branches of the tree extend upward and downward, nourished by the three
2.text: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखागुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवाला: |अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानिकर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके || 2||
2.transliteration: adhaśh chordhvaṁ prasṛitās tasya śhākhāguṇa-pravṛiddhā viṣhaya-pravālāḥadhaśh cha mūlāny anusantatānikarmānubandhīni manuṣhya-loke

3.meaning: The real form of this tree is not perceived in this world, neither its beginning nor end, nor its continued existence.  But this deep-rooted aśhvatth tree must be cut down with a strong axe of detachment.  Then one must search out the base of the tree, which is the Supreme Lord, from whom streamed forth the activity of the universe a long time ago.  Upon taking refuge in Him, one will not return to this world again.
3.text: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यतेनान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा |अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा || 3||तत: पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूय: |तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्येयत: प्रवृत्ति: प्रसृता पुराणी || 4||
3.transliteration: na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyatenānto na chādir na cha sampratiṣhṭhāaśhvattham enaṁ su-virūḍha-mūlamasaṅga-śhastreṇa dṛiḍhena chhittvātataḥ padaṁ tat parimārgitavyaṁyasmin gatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥtam eva chādyaṁ puruṣhaṁ prapadyeyataḥ pravṛittiḥ prasṛitā purāṇī

4.meaning: Those who are free from vanity and delusion, who have overcome the evil of attachment, who dwell constantly on the self and on God, who are free from the desire to enjoy the senses, and are beyond the dualities of pleasure and pain, such liberated personalities attain My eternal Abode.
4.text: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषाअध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामा: |द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ता: सुखदु:खसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढा: पदमव्ययं तत् || 5||

word_meanings.adhyātma-nityāḥ: dwelling constantly on the self and on God

4.transliteration: nirmāna-mohā jita-saṅga-doṣhāadhyātma-nityā vinivṛitta-kāmāḥdvandvair vimuktāḥ sukha-duḥkha-sanjñairgachchhanty amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṁ tat

5.meaning: Neither the sun nor the moon, nor fire can illumine that Supreme Abode of Mine.  Having gone There, one does not return to this material world again.
5.text: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावक: |यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम || 6||
5.transliteration: na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śhaśhāṅko na pāvakaḥyad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama

6.meaning: The embodied souls in this material world are My eternal fragmental parts.  But bound by material nature, they are struggling with the six senses including the mind.
6.text: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूत: सनातन: |मन:षष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति || 7||
6.transliteration: mamaivānśho jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥmanaḥ-ṣhaṣhṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛiti-sthāni karṣhati

7.meaning: As the air carries fragrance from place to place, so does the embodied soul carry the mind and senses with it, when it leaves an old body and enters a new one.

word_meanings.īśhvaraḥ: lord of the material body, the embodied soul

7.transliteration: śharīraṁ yad avāpnoti yach chāpy utkrāmatīśhvaraḥgṛihītvaitāni sanyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśhayāt

8.meaning: Using the sense perceptions of the ears, eyes, skin, tongue, and nose, which are grouped around the mind, the embodied soul savors the objects of the senses.
8.text: श्रोत्रं चक्षु: स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च |अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते || 9||
8.transliteration: śhrotraṁ chakṣhuḥ sparśhanaṁ cha rasanaṁ ghrāṇam eva chaadhiṣhṭhāya manaśh chāyaṁ viṣhayān upasevate

9.meaning: The ignorant do not perceive the soul as it resides in the body, and as it enjoys sense objects; nor do they perceive it when it departs.  But those who possess the eyes of knowledge can behold it.
9.text: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् |विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुष: || 10||

word_meanings.guṇa-anvitam: under the spell of the modes of material nature
word_meanings.jñāna-chakṣhuṣhaḥ: those who possess the eyes of knowledge

9.transliteration: utkrāmantaṁ sthitaṁ vāpi bhuñjānaṁ vā guṇānvitamvimūḍhā nānupaśhyanti paśhyanti jñāna-chakṣhuṣhaḥ

10.meaning: Striving yogis too are able to realize the soul enshrined in the body.  However, those whose minds are not purified cannot cognize it, even though they strive to do so.

word_meanings.akṛita-ātmānaḥ: those whose minds are not purified

10.transliteration: yatanto yoginaśh chainaṁ paśhyanty ātmany avasthitamyatanto ‘py akṛitātmāno nainaṁ paśhyanty achetasaḥ

11.meaning: Know that I am like the brilliance of the sun that illuminates the entire solar system.  The radiance of the moon and the brightness of the fire also come from Me.
11.text: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् |यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् || 12||
11.transliteration: yad āditya-gataṁ tejo jagad bhāsayate ’khilamyach chandramasi yach chāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam

12.meaning: Permeating the earth, I nourish all living beings with My energy.  Becoming the moon, I nourish all plants with the juice of life.
12.text: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा |पुष्णामि चौषधी: सर्वा: सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मक: || 13||
12.transliteration: gām āviśhya cha bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasāpuṣhṇāmi chauṣhadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ

13.meaning: It is I who take the form of the fire of digestion in the stomachs of all living beings, and combine with the incoming and outgoing breaths, to digest and assimilate the four kinds of foods.
13.text: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रित: |प्राणापानसमायुक्त: पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् || 14||
13.transliteration: ahaṁ vaiśhvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṁ deham āśhritaḥprāṇāpāna-samāyuktaḥ pachāmy annaṁ chatur-vidham

14.meaning: I am seated in the hearts of all living beings, and from Me come memory, knowledge, as well as forgetfulness.  I alone am to be known by all the Vedas, am the author of the Vedant, and the knower of the meaning of the Vedas.
14.text: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टोमत्त: स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च |वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्योवेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् || 15||

word_meanings.veda-vit: the knower of the meaning of the Vedas

14.transliteration: sarvasya chāhaṁ hṛidi sanniviṣhṭomattaḥ smṛitir jñānam apohanaṁ chavedaiśh cha sarvair aham eva vedyovedānta-kṛid veda-vid eva chāham

15.meaning: There are two kinds of beings in creation, the
15.text: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च |क्षर: सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते || 16||
15.transliteration: dvāv imau puruṣhau loke kṣharaśh chākṣhara eva chakṣharaḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭa-stho ’kṣhara uchyate

16.meaning: Besides these, is the Supreme Divine Personality, who is the indestructible Supreme Soul.  He enters the three worlds as the unchanging Controller and supports all living beings.
16.text: उत्तम: पुरुषस्त्वन्य: परमात्मेत्युदाहृत: |यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वर: || 17||
16.transliteration: uttamaḥ puruṣhas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛitaḥyo loka-trayam āviśhya bibharty avyaya īśhvaraḥ

17.meaning: I am transcendental to the perishable world of matter, and even to the imperishable soul; hence I am celebrated, both in the Vedas and the
17.text: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तम: |अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथित: पुरुषोत्तम: || 18||
17.transliteration: yasmāt kṣharam atīto ’ham akṣharād api chottamaḥato ’smi loke vede cha prathitaḥ puruṣhottamaḥ

18.meaning: Those who know Me without doubt as the Supreme Divine Personality truly have complete knowledge.  O Arjun, they worship Me with their whole being.
18.text: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् |स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत || 19||
18.transliteration: yo mām evam asammūḍho jānāti puruṣhottamamsa sarva-vid bhajati māṁ sarva-bhāvena bhārata

19.meaning: I have shared this most secret principle of the Vedic scriptures with you, O sinless Arjun.  By understanding this, a person becomes enlightened, and fulfills all that is to be accomplished.
19.text: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ |एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत || 20||

word_meanings.kṛita-kṛityaḥ: who fulfills all that is to be accomplished

19.transliteration: iti guhyatamaṁ śhāstram idam uktaṁ mayānaghaetad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛita-kṛityaśh cha bhārata

1.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.
1.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: |दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् || 1||अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैशुनम् |दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् || 2||तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहोनातिमानिता |भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत || 3||
1.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchaabhayaṁ sattva-sanśhuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥdānaṁ damaśh cha yajñaśh cha svādhyāyas tapa ārjavamahinsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śhāntir apaiśhunamdayā bhūteṣhv aloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr achāpalamtejaḥ kṣhamā dhṛitiḥ śhaucham adroho nāti-mānitābhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata

2.meaning: O Parth, the qualities of those who possess a demoniac nature are hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance.
2.text: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च |अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् || 4||
2.transliteration: dambho darpo ’bhimānaśh cha krodhaḥ pāruṣhyam eva chaajñānaṁ chābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm

3.meaning: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demoniac qualities are the cause for a continuing destiny of bondage. Grieve not, O Arjun, as you were born with saintly virtues.
3.text: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता |मा शुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव || 5||
3.transliteration: daivī sampad vimokṣhāya nibandhāyāsurī matāmā śhuchaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto ’si pāṇḍava

4.meaning: There are two kinds of beings in this world—those endowed with a divine nature and those possessing a demoniac nature. I have described the divine qualities in detail, O Arjun. Now hear from me about the demoniac nature.
4.text: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च |दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु || 6||
4.transliteration: dvau bhūta-sargau loke ’smin daiva āsura eva chadaivo vistaraśhaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śhṛiṇu

5.meaning: Those possessing a demoniac nature do not comprehend which actions are proper and which are improper. Hence, they possess neither purity, nor good conduct, nor even truthfulness.
5.text: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: |न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते || 7||
5.transliteration: pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha janā na vidur āsurāḥna śhauchaṁ nāpi chāchāro na satyaṁ teṣhu vidyate

6.meaning: They say, “The world is without Absolute Truth, without any basis (for moral order), and without a God (who has created or is controlling it). It is created from the combination of the two sexes, and has no purpose other than sexual gratification.”
6.transliteration: asatyam apratiṣhṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśhvaramaparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam

7.meaning: Holding fast to such views, these misdirected souls, with small intellect and cruel actions, arise as enemies of the world threatening its destruction.
7.transliteration: etāṁ dṛiṣhṭim avaṣhṭabhya naṣhṭātmāno ’lpa-buddhayaḥprabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣhayāya jagato ’hitāḥ

8.meaning: Harboring insatiable lust, full of hypocrisy, pride and arrogance, the demoniac cling to their false tenets. Thus illusioned, they are attracted to the impermanent and work with impure resolve.
8.transliteration: kāmam āśhritya duṣhpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥmohād gṛihītvāsad-grāhān pravartante ’śhuchi-vratāḥ

9.meaning: They are obsessed with endless anxieties that end only with death. Still, they maintain with complete assurance that gratification of desires and accumulation of wealth is the highest purpose of life.
9.transliteration: chintām aparimeyāṁ cha pralayāntām upāśhritāḥkāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niśhchitāḥ

10.meaning: Held in bondage by hundreds of desires, and driven by lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means, all for the gratification of their senses.

11.meaning: The demoniac persons think, “I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God Himself, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice.” In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.
11.text: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् |इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् || 13||असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि |ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी || 14||आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया |यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: || 15||
11.transliteration: idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manorathamidam astīdam api me bhaviṣhyati punar dhanamasau mayā hataḥ śhatrur haniṣhye chāparān apiīśhvaro ’ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho ’haṁ balavān sukhīāḍhyo ’bhijanavān asmi ko ’nyo ’sti sadṛiśho mayāyakṣhye dāsyāmi modiṣhya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ

12.meaning: Possessed and led astray by such imaginings, enveloped in a mesh of delusion, and addicted to the gratification of sensuous pleasures, they descend to the murkiest hell.

13.meaning: Such self-conceited and stubborn people, full of pride and arrogant in their wealth, perform ostentatious sacrifices in name only, with no regard to the rules of the scriptures.

word_meanings.avidhi-pūrvakam: with no regards to the rules of the scriptures

13.transliteration: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥyajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam

14.meaning: Blinded by egotism, strength, arrogance, desire, and anger, the demonic abuse Me, who am present in their own body and in the bodies of others.
14.text: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: |मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: || 18||

word_meanings.ātma-para-deheṣhu: within one’s own and bodies of others

14.transliteration: ahankāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ cha sanśhritāḥmām ātma-para-deheṣhu pradviṣhanto ’bhyasūyakāḥ

15.meaning: These cruel and hateful persons, the vile and vicious of humankind, I constantly hurl into the wombs of those with similar demoniac natures in the cycle of rebirth in the material world. These ignorant souls take birth again and again in demoniac wombs. Failing to reach Me, O Arjun, they gradually sink to the most abominable type of existence.
15.text: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् |क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु || 19||आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि |मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् || 20||

word_meanings.nara-adhamān: the vile and vicious of humankind

15.transliteration: tān ahaṁ dviṣhataḥ krūrān sansāreṣhu narādhamānkṣhipāmy ajasram aśhubhān āsurīṣhv eva yoniṣhuāsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmanimām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim

16.meaning: There are three gates leading to the hell of self-destruction for the soul—lust, anger, and greed. Therefore, one should abandon all three.
16.text: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: |काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् || 21||
16.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśhanam ātmanaḥkāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet

17.meaning: Those who are free from the three gates to darkness endeavor for the welfare of their soul, and thereby attain the supreme goal.
17.text: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: |आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् || 22||
17.transliteration: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥācharaty ātmanaḥ śhreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim

18.meaning: Those who act under the impulse of desire, discarding the injunctions of the scriptures, attain neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal in life.
18.text: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: |न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् || 23||
18.transliteration: yaḥ śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya vartate kāma-kārataḥna sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim

19.meaning: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Understand the scriptural injunctions and teachings, and then perform your actions in this world accordingly.
19.text: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ |ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि || 24||
19.transliteration: tasmāch chhāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitaujñātvā śhāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi

1.meaning: Arjun said: O Krishna, where do they stand who disregard the injunctions of the scriptures, but still worship with faith? Is their faith in the mode of goodness, passion, or ignorance?
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: |तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तम: || 1||
1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchaye śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥteṣhāṁ niṣhṭhā tu kā kṛiṣhṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ

2.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Every human being is born with innate faith, which can be of three kinds—
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा |सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु || 2||
2.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchatri-vidhā bhavati śhraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jāsāttvikī rājasī chaiva tāmasī cheti tāṁ śhṛiṇu

3.meaning: The faith of all humans conforms to the nature of their mind. All people possess faith, and whatever the nature of their faith, that is verily what they are.
3.text: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत |श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्ध: स एव स: || 3||

word_meanings.sattva-anurūpā: conforming to the nature of one’s mind
word_meanings.yat-śhraddhaḥ: whatever the nature of their faith

3.transliteration: sattvānurūpā sarvasya śhraddhā bhavati bhārataśhraddhā-mayo ‘yaṁ puruṣho yo yach-chhraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ

4.meaning: Those in the mode of goodness worship the celestial gods; those in the mode of passion worship the
4.text: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसा: |प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जना: || 4||

word_meanings.sāttvikāḥ: those in the mode of goodness
word_meanings.yakṣha: semi-celestial beings who exude power and wealth
word_meanings.rakṣhānsi: powerful beings who embody sensual enjoyment, revenge, and wrath
word_meanings.rājasāḥ: those in the mode of passion
word_meanings.tāmasāḥ: those in the mode of ignorance

4.transliteration: yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣha-rakṣhānsi rājasāḥpretān bhūta-gaṇānśh chānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ

5.meaning: Some people perform stern austerities that are not enjoined by the scriptures, but rather motivated by hypocrisy and egotism. Impelled by desire and attachment, they torment not only the elements of their body, but also I who dwell within them as the Supreme Soul. Know these senseless people to be of demoniacal resolves.
5.text: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: |दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: || 5||कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: |मां चैवान्त:शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् || 6||
5.transliteration: aśhāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥdambhāhankāra-sanyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥkarṣhayantaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam achetasaḥmāṁ chaivāntaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niśhchayān

6.meaning: The food that people prefer is according to their dispositions. The same is true for the sacrifice, austerity, and charity they are inclined (or predisposed) toward. Now hear of the distinctions from Me.
6.text: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रिय: |यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु || 7||
6.transliteration: āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥyajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣhāṁ bhedam imaṁ śhṛiṇu

7.meaning: Persons in the mode of goodness prefer foods that promote life span, and increase virtue, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction. Such foods are juicy, succulent, nourishing, and naturally tasteful.
7.text: आयु:सत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धना: |रस्या: स्निग्धा: स्थिरा हृद्या आहारा: सात्त्विकप्रिया: || 8||

word_meanings.sāttvika-priyāḥ: dear to those in the mode of goodness

8.meaning: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, very hot, pungent, dry, and full of chillies, are dear to persons in the mode of passion. Such foods produce pain, grief, and disease.

word_meanings.rājasasya: to persons in the mode of passion

9.meaning: Foods that are overcooked, stale, putrid, polluted, and impure are dear to persons in the mode of ignorance.
9.text: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् |उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् || 10||

word_meanings.tāmasa: to persons in the mode of ignorance

9.transliteration: yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣhitaṁ cha yatuchchhiṣhṭam api chāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam

10.meaning: Sacrifice that is performed according to scriptural injunctions without expectation of rewards, with the firm conviction of the mind that it is a matter of duty, is of the nature of goodness.
10.text: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते |यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्त्विक: || 11||

word_meanings.vidhi-driṣhṭaḥ: that is in accordance with the scriptural injunctions

10.transliteration: aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yajño vidhi-driṣhṭo ya ijyateyaṣhṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ

11.meaning: O best of the Bharatas, know that sacrifice performed for material benefit, or with a hypocritical aim, is in the mode of passion.
11.text: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् |इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् || 12||

word_meanings.bharata-śhreṣhṭha: Arjun, the best of the Bharatas

11.transliteration: abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api chaiva yatijyate bharata-śhreṣhṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam

12.meaning: Sacrifice devoid of faith and contrary to the injunctions of the scriptures, in which no food is offered, no mantras chanted, and no donation made, is to be considered in the mode of ignorance.

word_meanings.mantra-hīnam: with no chanting of the Vedic hymns
word_meanings.adakṣhiṇam: with no remunerations to the priests

12.transliteration: vidhi-hīnam asṛiṣhṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣhiṇamśhraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ parichakṣhate

13.meaning: When worship of the Supreme Lord, the Brahmins, the spiritual master, the wise, and the elders is done with the observance of cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy, and non-violence then this worship is declared as the austerity of the body.
13.text: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् |ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते || 14||
13.transliteration: deva-dwija-guru-prājña- pūjanaṁ śhaucham ārjavambrahmacharyam ahinsā cha śhārīraṁ tapa uchyate

14.meaning: Words that do not cause distress, are truthful, inoffensive, and beneficial, as well as regular recitation of the Vedic scriptures—these are declared as austerity of speech.
14.text: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् |स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते || 15||
14.transliteration: anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ cha yatsvādhyāyābhyasanaṁ chaiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa uchyate

15.meaning: Serenity of thought, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of purpose—all these are declared as austerity of the mind.
15.transliteration: manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥbhāva-sanśhuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam uchyate

16.meaning: When devout persons with ardent faith practice these three-fold austerities without yearning for material rewards, they are designated as austerities in the mode of goodness.
16.text: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरै: |अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तै: सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते || 17||
16.transliteration: śhraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥaphalākāṅkṣhibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ parichakṣhate

17.meaning: Austerity that is performed with ostentation for the sake of gaining honor, respect, and adoration is in the mode of passion. Its benefits are unstable and transitory.
17.text: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् |क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् || 18||
17.transliteration: satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena chaiva yatkriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ chalam adhruvam

18.meaning: Austerity that is performed by those with confused notions, and which involves torturing the self or harming others, is described to be in the mode of ignorance.
18.text: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तप: |परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् || 19||
18.transliteration: mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥparasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛitam

19.meaning: Charity given to a worthy person simply because it is right to give, without consideration of anything in return, at the proper time and in the proper place, is stated to be in the mode of goodness.
19.text: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे |देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् || 20||

word_meanings.anupakāriṇe: to one who cannot give in return

19.transliteration: dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate ‘nupakāriṇedeśhe kāle cha pātre cha tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛitam

20.meaning: But charity given with reluctance, with the hope of a return or in expectation of a reward, is said to be in the mode of passion.
20.text: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुन: |दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् || 21||

word_meanings.prati-upakāra-artham: with the hope of a return

20.transliteration: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśhya vā punaḥdīyate cha parikliṣhṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam

21.meaning: And that charity, which is given at the wrong place and wrong time to unworthy persons, without showing respect, or with contempt, is held to be of the nature of nescience.
21.transliteration: adeśha-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaśh cha dīyateasat-kṛitam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam

22.meaning: The words “Om Tat Sat” have been declared as symbolic representations of the Supreme Absolute Truth, from the beginning of creation. From them came the priests, scriptures, and sacrifice.
22.text: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविध: स्मृत: |ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिता: पुरा || 23||
22.transliteration: oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśho brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛitaḥbrāhmaṇās tena vedāśh cha yajñāśh cha vihitāḥ purā

23.meaning: Therefore, when performing acts of sacrifice, offering charity, or undertaking penance, expounders of the Vedas always begin by uttering “Om” according to the prescriptions of Vedic injunctions.
23.text: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतप:क्रिया: |प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता: सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् || 24||

word_meanings.vidhāna-uktāḥ: according to the prescriptions of Vedic injunctions

23.transliteration: tasmād oṁ ity udāhṛitya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥpravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām

24.meaning: Persons who do not desire fruitive rewards, but seek to be free from material entanglements, utter the word “Tat” along with acts of austerity, sacrifice, and charity.
24.text: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रिया: |दानक्रियाश्च विविधा: क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभि: || 25||

word_meanings.mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ: by seekers of freedom from material entanglements

24.transliteration: tad ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥdāna-kriyāśh cha vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ

25.meaning: The word “Sat” means eternal existence and goodness. O Arjun, it is also used to describe an auspicious action. Being established in the performance of sacrifice, penance, and charity, is also described by the word “Sat.” And so any act for such purposes is named “Sat.”
25.text: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते |प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते || 26||यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते |कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते || 27||

word_meanings.sat-bhāve: with the intention of eternal existence and goodness

25.transliteration: sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve cha sad ity etat prayujyatepraśhaste karmaṇi tathā sach-chhabdaḥ pārtha yujyateyajñe tapasi dāne cha sthitiḥ sad iti chochyatekarma chaiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate

26.meaning: O son of Pritha, whatever acts of sacrifice, charity, or penance are done without faith, are termed as
26.text: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् |असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह || 28||
26.transliteration: aśhraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛitaṁ cha yatasad ity uchyate pārtha na cha tat pretya no iha

1.meaning: Arjun said: O mighty-armed Krishna, I wish to understand the nature of
1.text: अर्जुन उवाच |सन्न्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् |त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन || 1||

word_meanings.tyāgasya: of renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions
word_meanings.hṛiṣhīkeśha: Krishna, the Lord of the senses
word_meanings.keśhī-niṣhūdana: Krishna, the killer of the Keshi demon

1.transliteration: arjuna uvāchasannyāsasya mahā-bāho tattvam ichchhāmi veditumtyāgasya cha hṛiṣhīkeśha pṛithak keśhi-niṣhūdana

2.meaning: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Giving up of actions motivated by desire is what the wise understand as
2.text: श्रीभगवानुवाच |काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं सन्न्यासं कवयो विदु: |सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणा: || 2||

word_meanings.tyāgam: renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

2.transliteration: śhrī-bhagavān uvāchakāmyānāṁ karmaṇāṁ nyāsaṁ sannyāsaṁ kavayo viduḥsarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ prāhus tyāgaṁ vichakṣhaṇāḥ

3.meaning: Some learned people declare that all kinds of actions should be given up as evil, while others maintain that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned.
3.text: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिण: |यज्ञदानतप:कर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे || 3||
3.transliteration: tyājyaṁ doṣha-vad ity eke karma prāhur manīṣhiṇaḥyajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyam iti chāpare

4.meaning: Now hear My conclusion on the subject of renunciation, O tiger amongst men, for renunciation has been declared to be of three kinds.
4.text: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम |त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविध: सम्प्रकीर्तित: || 4||

word_meanings.tyāge: about renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions
word_meanings.tyāgaḥ: renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

4.transliteration: niśhchayaṁ śhṛiṇu me tatra tyāge bharata-sattamatyāgo hi puruṣha-vyāghra tri-vidhaḥ samprakīrtitaḥ

5.meaning: Actions based upon sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned; they must certainly be performed. Indeed, acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance are purifying even for those who are wise.
5.text: यज्ञदानतप:कर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् |यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् || 5||
5.transliteration: yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyaṁ kāryam eva tatyajño dānaṁ tapaśh chaiva pāvanāni manīṣhiṇām

6.meaning: These activities must be performed without attachment and expectation for rewards. This is My definite and supreme verdict, O Arjun.
6.text: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च |कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् || 6||
6.transliteration: etāny api tu karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalāni chakartavyānīti me pārtha niśhchitaṁ matam uttamam

7.meaning: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. Such deluded renunciation is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
7.text: नियतस्य तु सन्न्यास: कर्मणो नोपपद्यते |मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामस: परिकीर्तित: || 7||
7.transliteration: niyatasya tu sannyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyatemohāt tasya parityāgas tāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ

8.meaning: To give up prescribed duties because they are troublesome or cause bodily discomfort is renunciation in the mode of passion. Such renunciation is never beneficial or elevating.
8.text: दु:खमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्यजेत् |स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् || 8||

word_meanings.tyāgam: renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions
word_meanings.tyāga: renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

8.transliteration: duḥkham ity eva yat karma kāya-kleśha-bhayāt tyajetsa kṛitvā rājasaṁ tyāgaṁ naiva tyāga-phalaṁ labhet

9.meaning: When actions are undertaken in response to duty, and one relinquishes attachment to any reward, O Arjun, it is considered renunciation in the nature of goodness.
9.text: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन |सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्याग: सात्त्विको मत: || 9||

word_meanings.tyāgaḥ: renunciation of desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

9.transliteration: kāryam ity eva yat karma niyataṁ kriyate ‘rjunasaṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalaṁ chaiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ

10.meaning: Those who neither avoid disagreeable work nor seek work because it is agreeable are persons of true renunciation. They are endowed with the quality of the mode of goodness and have no doubts (about the nature of work).
10.text: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते |त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशय: || 10||

word_meanings.tyāgī: one who renounces desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

10.transliteration: na dveṣhṭy akuśhalaṁ karma kuśhale nānuṣhajjatetyāgī sattva-samāviṣhṭo medhāvī chhinna-sanśhayaḥ

11.meaning: For the embodied being, it is impossible to give up activities entirely. But those who relinquish the fruits of their actions are said to be truly renounced.
11.text: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषत: |यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते || 11||

word_meanings.tyāgī: one who renounces all desires for enjoying the fruits of actions

11.transliteration: na hi deha-bhṛitā śhakyaṁ tyaktuṁ karmāṇy aśheṣhataḥyas tu karma-phala-tyāgī sa tyāgīty abhidhīyate

12.meaning: The three-fold fruits of actions—pleasant, unpleasant, and mixed—accrue even after death to those who are attached to personal reward. But, for those who renounce the fruits of their actions, there are no such results in the here or hereafter.
12.text: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मण: फलम् |भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित् || 12||

word_meanings.atyāginām: to those who are attached to personal reward

12.transliteration: aniṣhṭam iṣhṭaṁ miśhraṁ cha tri-vidhaṁ karmaṇaḥ phalambhavaty atyāgināṁ pretya na tu sannyāsināṁ kvachit

13.meaning: O Arjun, now learn from Me about the five factors that have been mentioned for the accomplishment of all actions in the doctrine of
13.text: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे |साङ् ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् || 13||
13.transliteration: pañchaitāni mahā-bāho kāraṇāni nibodha mesānkhye kṛitānte proktāni siddhaye sarva-karmaṇām

14.meaning: The body, the doer (soul), the various senses, the many kinds of efforts, and Divine Providence—these are the five factors of action.
14.text: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् |विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् || 14||
14.transliteration: adhiṣhṭhānaṁ tathā kartā karaṇaṁ cha pṛithag-vidhamvividhāśh cha pṛithak cheṣhṭā daivaṁ chaivātra pañchamam

15.meaning: These five are the contributory factors for whatever action is performed, whether proper or improper, with body, speech, or mind. Those who do not understand this regard the soul as the only doer. With their impure intellects they cannot see things as they are.
15.text: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नर: |न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतव: || 15||तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु य: |पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मति: || 16||
15.transliteration: śharīra-vāṅ-manobhir yat karma prārabhate naraḥnyāyyaṁ vā viparītaṁ vā pañchaite tasya hetavaḥtatraivaṁ sati kartāram ātmānaṁ kevalaṁ tu yaḥpaśhyaty akṛita-buddhitvān na sa paśhyati durmatiḥ

16.meaning: Those who are free from the ego of being the doer, and whose intellect is unattached, though they may slay living beings, they neither kill nor are they bound by actions.
16.text: यस्य नाहङ् कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते |हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते || 17||

word_meanings.na ahankṛitaḥ: free from the ego of being the doer

16.transliteration: yasya nāhankṛito bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyatehatvā ‘pi sa imāñl lokān na hanti na nibadhyate

17.meaning: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the three factors that induce action. The instrument of action, the act itself, and the doer—these are the three constituents of action.
17.text: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना |करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविध: कर्मसंग्रह: || 18||
17.transliteration: jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-chodanākaraṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ

18.meaning: Knowledge, action, and the doer are declared to be of three kinds in the
18.text: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदत: |प्रोच्यते गुणसङ् ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि || 19||

word_meanings.guṇa-bhedataḥ: distinguished according to the three modes of material nature
word_meanings.guṇa-saṅkhyāne: Sānkhya philosophy, which describes the modes of material nature

18.transliteration: jñānaṁ karma cha kartā cha tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥprochyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvach chhṛiṇu tāny api

19.meaning: Understand that knowledge to be in the mode of goodness by which a person sees one undivided imperishable reality within all diverse living beings.
19.text: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते |अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् || 20||
19.transliteration: sarva-bhūteṣhu yenaikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣhateavibhaktaṁ vibhakteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam

20.meaning: That knowledge is to be considered in the mode of passion by which one sees manifold living entities in diverse bodies as individual and unconnected.
20.text: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् |वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् || 21||
20.transliteration: pṛithaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛithag-vidhānvetti sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam

21.meaning: That knowledge is said to be in the mode of ignorance where one is engrossed in a fragmental concept as if it encompasses the whole, and which is neither grounded in reason nor based on the truth.

word_meanings.kṛitsna-vat: as if it encompasses the whole

21.transliteration: yat tu kṛitsna-vad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukamatattvārtha-vad alpaṁ cha tat tāmasam udāhṛitam

22.meaning: Action that is in accordance with the scriptures, free from attachment and aversion, and done without desire for rewards, is in the mode of goodness.
22.transliteration: niyataṁ saṅga-rahitam arāga-dveṣhataḥ kṛitamaphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam uchyate

23.meaning: Action that is prompted by selfish desire, enacted with pride, and full of stress, is in the nature of passion.
23.text: यत्तुकामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुन: |क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् || 24||
23.transliteration: yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhankārena vā punaḥkriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tad rājasam udāhṛitam

24.meaning: That action is declared to be in the mode of ignorance, which is begun out of delusion, without thought to one’s own ability, and disregarding consequences, loss, and injury to others.
24.text: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् |मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यतत्तामसमुच्यते || 25||
24.transliteration: anubandhaṁ kṣhayaṁ hinsām anapekṣhya cha pauruṣhammohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam uchyate

25.meaning: The performer is said to be in the mode of goodness, when he or she is free from egotism and attachment, endowed with enthusiasm and determination, and equipoised in success and failure.
25.transliteration: mukta-saṅgo ‘nahaṁ-vādī dhṛity-utsāha-samanvitaḥsiddhy-asiddhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika uchyate

26.meaning: The performer is considered in the mode of passion when he or she craves the fruits of the work, is covetous, violent-natured, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow.
26.text: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचि: |हर्षशोकान्वित: कर्ता राजस: परिकीर्तित: || 27||
26.transliteration: rāgī karma-phala-prepsur lubdho hinsātmako ‘śhuchiḥharṣha-śhokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ

27.meaning: A performer in the mode of ignorance is one who is undisciplined, vulgar, stubborn, deceitful, slothful, despondent, and a procrastinator.
27.text: अयुक्त: प्राकृत: स्तब्ध: शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलस: |विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते || 28||
27.transliteration: ayuktaḥ prākṛitaḥ stabdhaḥ śhaṭho naiṣhkṛitiko ‘lasaḥviṣhādī dīrgha-sūtrī cha kartā tāmasa uchyate

28.meaning: Hear now, O Arjun, of the distinctions of intellect and determination, according to the three modes of material nature, as I describe them in detail.
28.text: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु |प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय || 29||

word_meanings.guṇataḥ tri-vidham: according to the three modes of material nature

28.transliteration: buddher bhedaṁ dhṛiteśh chaiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇuprochyamānam aśheṣheṇa pṛithaktvena dhanañjaya

29.meaning: The intellect is said to be in the nature of goodness, O Parth, when it understands what is proper action and improper action, what is duty and non-duty, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating.
29.text: प्रवृत्तिंच निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये |बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्तिबुद्धि: सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी || 30||
29.transliteration: pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha kāryākārye bhayābhayebandhaṁ mokṣhaṁ cha yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī

30.meaning: The intellect is considered in the mode of passion when it is confused between righteousness and unrighteousness, and cannot distinguish between right and wrong conduct, O Parth.
30.text: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च |अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धि: सा पार्थ राजसी || 31||
30.transliteration: yayā dharmam adharmaṁ cha kāryaṁ chākāryam eva chaayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī

31.meaning: That intellect which is shrouded in darkness, imagining irreligion to be religion, and perceiving untruth to be the truth, is of the nature of ignorance, O Parth.
31.text: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता |सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धि: सा पार्थ तामसी || 32||
31.transliteration: adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛitāsarvārthān viparītānśh cha buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī

32.meaning: The steadfast willpower that is developed through Yog, and which sustains the activities of the mind, the life-airs, and the senses,  O Parth, is said to be determination in the mode of goodness.
32.text: धृत्या यया धारयते मन:प्राणेन्द्रियक्रिया: |योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृति: सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी || 33||
32.transliteration: dhṛityā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥyogenāvyabhichāriṇyā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī

33.meaning: The steadfast willpower by which one holds on to duty, pleasures, and wealth, out of attachment and desire for rewards, O Arjun, is determination in the mode of passion.
33.text: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन |प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ् क्षी धृति: सा पार्थ राजसी || 34||
33.transliteration: yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛityā dhārayate ‘rjunaprasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣhī dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha rājasī

34.meaning: That unintelligent resolve is said to be determination in the mode of ignorance, in which one does not give up dreaming, fearing, grieving, despair, and conceit.
34.text: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च |न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृति: सा पार्थ तामसी || 35||
34.transliteration: yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śhokaṁ viṣhādaṁ madam eva chana vimuñchati durmedhā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī

35.meaning: Now hear from Me, O Arjun, of the three kinds of happiness in which the embodied soul rejoices, and can even reach the end of all suffering.
35.text: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ |अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दु:खान्तं च निगच्छति || 36||

word_meanings.bharata-ṛiṣhabha: Arjun, the best of the Bharatas

35.transliteration: sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu me bharatarṣhabhaabhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ cha nigachchhati

36.meaning: That which seems like poison at first, but tastes like nectar in the end, is said to be happiness in the mode of goodness. It is generated by the pure intellect that is situated in self-knowledge.
36.transliteration: yat tad agre viṣham iva pariṇāme ‘mṛitopamamtat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam

37.meaning: Happiness is said to be in the mode of passion when it is derived from the contact of the senses with their objects. Such happiness is like nectar at first but poison at the end.
37.transliteration: viṣhayendriya-sanyogād yat tad agre ’mṛitopamampariṇāme viṣham iva tat sukhaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam

38.meaning: That happiness which covers the nature of the self from beginning to end, and which is derived from sleep, indolence, and negligence, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
38.text: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मन: |निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् || 39||
38.transliteration: yad agre chānubandhe cha sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥnidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam

39.meaning: No living being on earth or the higher celestial abodes of this material realm is free from the influence of these three modes of nature.
39.text: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुन: |सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभि: स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणै: || 40||
39.transliteration: na tad asti pṛithivyāṁ vā divi deveṣhu vā punaḥsattvaṁ prakṛiti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ

40.meaning: The duties of the Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras—are distributed according to their qualities, in accordance with their
40.text: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप |कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणै: || 41||

word_meanings.svabhāva-prabhavaiḥ-guṇaiḥ: work based on one’s nature and guṇas

40.transliteration: brāhmaṇa-kṣhatriya-viśhāṁ śhūdrāṇāṁ cha parantapakarmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ

41.meaning: Tranquility, restraint, austerity, purity, patience, integrity, knowledge, wisdom, and belief in a hereafter—these are the intrinsic qualities of work for Brahmins.
41.text: शमो दमस्तप: शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च |ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् || 42||
41.transliteration: śhamo damas tapaḥ śhauchaṁ kṣhāntir ārjavam eva chajñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam

42.meaning: Valor, strength, fortitude, skill in weaponry, resolve never to retreat from battle, large-heartedness in charity, and leadership abilities, these are the natural qualities of work for Kshatriyas.
42.text: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् |दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् || 43||

word_meanings.kṣhātram: of the warrior and administrative class

42.transliteration: śhauryaṁ tejo dhṛitir dākṣhyaṁ yuddhe chāpy apalāyanamdānam īśhvara-bhāvaśh cha kṣhātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam

43.meaning: Agriculture, dairy farming, and commerce are the natural works for those with the qualities of Vaishyas. Serving through work is the natural duty for those with the qualities of Shudras.
43.text: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् |परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् || 44||

word_meanings.vaiśhya: of the mercantile and farming class

43.transliteration: kṛiṣhi-gau-rakṣhya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśhya-karma svabhāva-jamparicharyātmakaṁ karma śhūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam

44.meaning: By fulfilling their duties, born of their innate qualities, human beings can attain perfection. Now hear from Me how one can become perfect by discharging one’s prescribed duties.
44.text: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरत: संसिद्धिं लभते नर: |स्वकर्मनिरत: सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु || 45||
44.transliteration: sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ sansiddhiṁ labhate naraḥsva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tach chhṛiṇu

45.meaning: By performing one’s natural occupation, one worships the Creator from whom all living entities have come into being, and by whom the whole universe is pervaded. By such performance of work, a person easily attains perfection.
45.text: यत: प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् |स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानव: || 46||
45.transliteration: yataḥ pravṛittir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatamsva-karmaṇā tam abhyarchya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ

46.meaning: It is better to do one’s own
46.text: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुण: परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् |स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् || 47||
46.transliteration: śhreyān swa-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitātsvabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham

47.meaning: One should not abandon duties born of one’s nature, even if one sees defects in them, O son of Kunti. Indeed, all endeavors are veiled by some evil, as fire is by smoke.
47.text: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् |सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृता: || 48||
47.transliteration: saha-jaṁ karma kaunteya sa-doṣham api na tyajetsarvārambhā hi doṣheṇa dhūmenāgnir ivāvṛitāḥ

48.meaning: Those whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who have mastered the mind, and are free from desires by the practice of renunciation, attain the highest perfection of freedom from action.
48.text: असक्तबुद्धि: सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृह: |नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां सन्न्यासेनाधिगच्छति || 49||
48.transliteration: asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛihaḥnaiṣhkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ sannyāsenādhigachchhati

49.meaning: Hear from Me briefly, O Arjun, and I shall explain how one, who has attained perfection (of cessation of actions), can also attain Brahman by being firmly fixed in transcendental knowledge.
49.text: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे |समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा || 50||
49.transliteration: siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha mesamāsenaiva kaunteya niṣhṭhā jñānasya yā parā

50.meaning: One becomes fit to attain Brahman when he or she possesses a purified intellect and firmly restrains the senses, abandoning sound and other objects of the senses, casting aside attraction and aversion. Such a person relishes solitude, eats lightly, controls body, mind, and speech, is ever engaged in meditation, and practices dispassion. Free from egotism, violence, arrogance, desire, possessiveness of property, and selfishness, such a person, situated in tranquility, is fit for union with Brahman (i.e., realization of the Absolute Truth as Brahman).
50.text: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च |शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च || 51||विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानस: |ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रित: || 52||अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् |विमुच्य निर्मम: शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते || 53||

word_meanings.śhabda-ādīn viṣhayān: sound and other objects of the senses

50.transliteration: buddhyā viśhuddhayā yukto dhṛityātmānaṁ niyamya chaśhabdādīn viṣhayāns tyaktvā rāga-dveṣhau vyudasya chavivikta-sevī laghv-āśhī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥdhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśhritaḥahankāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigrahamvimuchya nirmamaḥ śhānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate

51.meaning: One situated in the transcendental Brahman realization becomes mentally serene, neither grieving nor desiring. Being equitably disposed toward all living beings, such a yogi attains supreme devotion unto Me.
51.text: ब्रह्मभूत: प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ् क्षति |सम: सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् || 54||
51.transliteration: brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śhochati na kāṅkṣhatisamaḥ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām

52.meaning: Only by loving devotion to Me does one come to know who I am in Truth. Then, having come to know Me, My devotee enters into full consciousness of Me.
52.text: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वत: |ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् || 55||
52.transliteration: bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaśh chāsmi tattvataḥtato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśhate tad-anantaram

53.meaning: My devotees, though performing all kinds of actions, take full refuge in Me. By my grace, they attain the eternal and imperishable abode.
53.text: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रय: |मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् || 56||
53.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśhrayaḥmat-prasādād avāpnoti śhāśhvataṁ padam avyayam

54.meaning: Dedicate your every activity to Me, making Me your supreme goal. Taking shelter of the Yog of the intellect, keep your consciousness absorbed in Me always.
54.text: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्पर: |बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्त: सततं भव || 57||

word_meanings.mat-paraḥ: having me as the supreme goal
word_meanings.buddhi-yogam: having the intellect united with God

54.transliteration: chetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥbuddhi-yogam upāśhritya mach-chittaḥ satataṁ bhava

55.meaning: If you always remember Me, by My grace you shall overcome all obstacles and difficulties. But if, due to pride, you do not listen to My advice, you will perish.
55.text: मच्चित्त: सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि |अथ चेत्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि || 58||
55.transliteration: mach-chittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣhyasiatha chet tvam ahankārān na śhroṣhyasi vinaṅkṣhyasi

56.meaning: If, motivated by pride, you think, “I shall not fight,” your decision will be in vain. Your own nature will compel you to fight.
56.text: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे |मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति || 59||
56.transliteration: yad ahankāram āśhritya na yotsya iti manyasemithyaiṣha vyavasāyas te prakṛitis tvāṁ niyokṣhyati

57.meaning: O Arjun, that action which out of delusion you do not wish to do, you will be driven to do it by your own inclination, born of your own material nature.
57.text: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्ध: स्वेन कर्मणा |कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् || 60||

word_meanings.swabhāva-jena: born of one’s own material nature

57.transliteration: swbhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇākartuṁ nechchhasi yan mohāt kariṣhyasy avaśho ’pi tat

58.meaning: The Supreme Lord dwells in the hearts of all living beings, O Arjun. According to their karmas, He directs the wanderings of the souls, who are seated on a machine made of material energy.
58.text: ईश्वर: सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति |भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया || 61||
58.transliteration: īśhvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛid-deśhe ‘rjuna tiṣhṭhatibhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā

59.meaning: Surrender exclusively unto Him with your whole being, O Bharat. By His grace, you will attain perfect peace and the eternal abode.
59.text: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत |तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् || 62||
59.transliteration: tam eva śharaṇaṁ gachchha sarva-bhāvena bhāratatat-prasādāt parāṁ śhāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śhāśhvatam

60.meaning: Thus, I have explained to you this knowledge that is more secret than all secrets. Ponder over it deeply, and then do as you wish.
60.text: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया |विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु || 63||
60.transliteration: iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayāvimṛiśhyaitad aśheṣheṇa yathechchhasi tathā kuru

61.meaning: Hear again My supreme instruction, the most confidential of all knowledge. I am revealing this for your benefit because you are very dear to Me.
61.text: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूय: शृणु मे परमं वच: |इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् || 64||
61.transliteration: sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥiṣhṭo ‘si me dṛiḍham iti tato vakṣhyāmi te hitam

62.meaning: Always think of Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer obeisance to Me. Doing so, you will certainly come to Me. This is My pledge to you, for you are very dear to Me.
62.text: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे || 65||
62.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskurumām evaiṣhyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo ‘si me

63.meaning: Abandon all varieties of dharmas and simply surrender unto Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not fear.
63.text: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज |अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुच: || 66||
63.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vrajaahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ

64.meaning: This instruction should never be explained to those who are not austere or to those who are not devoted. It should also not be spoken to those who are averse to listening (to spiritual topics), and especially not to those who are envious of Me.
64.text: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन |न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति || 67||

word_meanings.atapaskāya: to those who are not austere
word_meanings.abhaktāya: to those who are not devoted
word_meanings.aśhuśhrūṣhave: to those who are averse to listening (to spiritual topics)

64.transliteration: idaṁ te nātapaskyāya nābhaktāya kadāchanana chāśhuśhruṣhave vāchyaṁ na cha māṁ yo ‘bhyasūtayi

65.meaning: Amongst My devotees, those who teach this most confidential knowledge perform the greatest act of love. They will come to Me, without doubt.
65.text: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति |भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशय: || 68||
65.transliteration: ya idaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣhv abhidhāsyatibhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛitvā mām evaiṣhyaty asanśhayaḥ

66.meaning: No human being does more loving service to Me than they; nor shall there ever be anyone on this earth more dear to Me.
66.text: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तम: |भविता न च मे तस्मादन्य: प्रियतरो भुवि || 69||
66.transliteration: na cha tasmān manuṣhyeṣhu kaśhchin me priya-kṛittamaḥbhavitā na cha me tasmād anyaḥ priyataro bhuvi

67.meaning: And I proclaim that those who study this sacred dialogue of ours will worship Me (with their intellect) through the sacrifice of knowledge; such is My view.
67.text: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयो: |ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्ट: स्यामिति मे मति: || 70||
67.transliteration: adhyeṣhyate cha ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥjñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣhṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ

68.meaning: Even those who only listen to this knowledge with faith and without envy will be liberated from sins and attain the auspicious abodes where the pious dwell.
68.text: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नर: |सोऽपि मुक्त: शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् || 71||
68.transliteration: śhraddhāvān anasūyaśh cha śhṛiṇuyād api yo naraḥso ‘pi muktaḥ śhubhāñl lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām

69.meaning: O Arjun, have you heard Me with a concentrated mind? Have your ignorance and delusion been destroyed?
69.text: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा |कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोह: प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय || 72||
69.transliteration: kachchid etach chhrutaṁ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa chetasākachchid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣhṭas te dhanañjaya

70.meaning: Arjun said: O Infallible One, by your grace my illusion has been dispelled, and I am situated in knowledge. I am now free from doubts, and I shall act according to Your instructions.
70.text: अर्जुन उवाच |नष्टो मोह: स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत |स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देह: करिष्ये वचनं तव || 73||
70.transliteration: arjuna uvāchanaṣhṭo mohaḥ smṛitir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayāchyutasthito ‘smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣhye vachanaṁ tava

71.meaning: Sanjay said: Thus, have I heard this wonderful conversation between Shree Krishna, the Son of Vasudev, and Arjun, the noble-hearted son of Pritha. So thrilling is the message that my hair is standing on end.
71.text: सञ्जय उवाच |इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मन: |संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् || 74||

word_meanings.roma-harṣhaṇam: which causes the hair to stand on end

71.transliteration: sañjaya uvāchaity ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya cha mahātmanaḥsaṁvādam imam aśhrauṣham adbhutaṁ roma-harṣhaṇam

72.meaning: By the grace of Veda Vyas, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yog from the Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna Himself.

word_meanings.vyāsa-prasādāt: by the grace of Ved Vyas

72.transliteration: vyāsa-prasādāch chhrutavān etad guhyam ahaṁ paramyogaṁ yogeśhvarāt kṛiṣhṇāt sākṣhāt kathayataḥ svayam

73.meaning: As I repeatedly recall this astonishing and wonderful dialogue between the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun, O King, I rejoice again and again.
73.text: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् |केशवार्जुनयो: पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहु: || 76||

word_meanings.keśhava-arjunayoḥ: between Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun

73.transliteration: rājan sansmṛitya sansmṛitya saṁvādam imam adbhutamkeśhavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛiṣhyāmi cha muhur muhuḥ

74.meaning: And remembering that most astonishing and wonderful cosmic form of Lord Krishna, great is my astonishment, and I am thrilled with joy over and over again.
74.text: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरे: |विस्मयो मे महानराजन्हृष्यामि च पुन: पुन: || 77||
74.transliteration: tach cha sansmṛitya sansmṛitya rūpam aty-adbhutaṁ hareḥvismayo ye mahān rājan hṛiṣhyāmi cha punaḥ punaḥ

75.meaning: Wherever there is Shree Krishna, the Lord of all Yog, and wherever there is Arjun, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be unending opulence, victory, prosperity, and righteousness. Of this, I am certain.
75.text: यत्र योगेश्वर: कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धर: |तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम || 78||

word_meanings.yoga-īśhvaraḥ: Shree Krishna, the Lord of Yog

75.transliteration: yatra yogeśhvaraḥ kṛiṣhṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥtatra śhrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama
